Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: austinboy
Reviews.Content: I would rate this hotel as average at best for the price. The staff is very nice. The accomodations are clean, but a little below average. The neighborhood late at night is not terribly great. i paid for a suite. The rooms were very not at night, so we needed to open the windows, which made it loud. The beds for the third guest, my adult son, was a fold out chair not laong enough for anyone over six feet tall. There are better deals in Paris, this is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good”
Reviews.Author: wawagal
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this hotel over the years, and have never been disappointed. We have probably stayed in every room type, and prefer the rooms overlooking the front of the hotel, as opposed to the light well at the back. Of course if the window is open you will get all associated city noises, which is not surprising! It is always spotlessly clean, the rooms are spacious. Its in a great location for a spot of shopping at the Galerie Lafayette.Breakfast in the little breakfast room off the lobby, is fine. A little cosy, but i would recommend it as opposed to looking around the area for something else. Its very french, which is just what we like in France!!

Reviews.Title: “If you like character and homeliness in a hotel, then Hôtel Langlois (formerly Hôtel des Croisés)”
Reviews.Author: Deana J
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel full of character close to Gare St Lazare and Grands Boulevards. One minutes' walk to the nearest metro station (Trinité) and bakeries, take-aways and cafés all a few doors' down from the hotel. I had a single room for 2 nights which was on the 6th and last floor (Room No. 64). It was spacious, clean and decorated with antique fixtures and furniture. I had a fantastic view of the Sacré Coeur church in Montmartre from the bedroom window. There was a faint smokey smell in the pillows, but apart from that, no complaints. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “try and you will love it”
Reviews.Author: recentguest2011
Reviews.Content: great location very nice rooms furnished with old stylish furniture very parisian very friendly staff shopping centres opera walking distance and many restaurants around

Reviews.Title: “Very claen and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: jseven
Reviews.Content: Large room on 3rd floor.Windows onto internal courtyard. Must be the quietest room in Paris. Beautiful,enormous art deco bathroom. Staff very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel in an old and charming building”
Reviews.Author: RamblerRambling
Reviews.Content: It's always nice to stay in a hotel that has history. I much prefer the feel of worn wood under my feet when I walk in than buffed marble. This hotel is a very pleasant place to rest your head at night after a long day of sightseeing. The room we stayed in was very large, with a fireplace and a bathroom half the size of the room itself. Staff was affable and helpful, and I loved the old elevator. I'm glad we found this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Ericvg
Reviews.Content: I stayed here back in June 2008, so bear in mind some of this may have changed, but I'm sure it's relatively unchanged. The Hotel Langlois is a fantastic, affordable, classic Paris hotel. The room we had, which was a two-room suite, was comfortable and large. It had high ceilings, a bathroom that was spacious and clean, and a television with cable. The view was very cool - it looked out onto the front street where every morning we could open the windows and see businessmen and women buzzing about on the streets. Our room was on the third floor, and there is a small elevator, which is unique and beautifully adorned in wood, but it is not necessary to use all the time. The marble stairs are large and on a gentle incline so unless you're on the top floor or unable to use stairs, it isn't a big problem. The service was friendly - the front desk and breakfast staff were helpful and smiled when they saw us. There were free newspapers (The International Herald Tribune) at the desk every morning and breakfast was served in a front room. We ate there a few times but generally went to the corner and had a delicious breakfast at the cafe right there looking out at the plaza. The location is excellent. It's in Paris's 9th district and therefore is convenient to many quintessential Parisian sites and places. There are many excellent restaurants nearby. Also, the hotel is in a location that is not too frequented by tourists, so you feel like a Parisian resident yourself when staying there. The metro is nearby and taxis are plentiful in the area. There is a bike-sharing system at the foot of the street, viewable from the front rooms in the hotel. Overall, it's a relatively affordable and hotel that is unique and filled with character and individuality. You will not find this anywhere else in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: tk44
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a business trip and spent very little time actually inside the room. But I was satisfied with what I had - the antique feel was very 'parisienne' and I named my room 'the princess room' as soon as I checked into my 6th floor room, because of the sitting area. It looked like a charming little gazebo (there is a photo of this room onthe hotel web page under standard rooms). The room was well enough equipped - closets, tv, suitcase rack, hair dryer and a reliable wifi connection. Many lower budget hotels in Paris offer wifi these days, but most cannot actually guarantee it inside rooms. Many times I've sat on the stairs and to check my e-mails nodding and smiling at the elderly japanese couples taking photos of this curious scene. Many travelers here have complained about noise, but I guess that was before the sound-proofed windows. The only noise keeping me awake was the washing machines. I think they were next-door to this prnicess room of mine, because there was a 'staff only' door and the noise ran all night and went silent again in the morning. But I always use earplugs when sleeping in strange places anyway, so that failed to really bother me. The sites I needed - Sacre Coeur and the Montmartre area - were really close (we walked around all day, had tea on the hillside and it was all charming again). And the metro is just around the corner. We strolled around with our suitcases and had no problems. A tip for if you stay here - around another corner (right side street from the Trinite church) is a small store ('Jardin de Trinite'), where you can get fruit and water etc. And about a 5 min walk to the right from the hotel on Taitbout street there is a larger grocery store 'Franprix', where you can get yoghurt and all sorts of other goods if you are looking to spend less and skip the 13 euro breakfast. Oh yeah, and the elevator is like a movie classic. There aren't too many of those anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Classic”
Reviews.Author: Suland
Reviews.Content: A great classic Paris hotel. I still would rather be in the 5th or 6th, but this is my favorite on the right bank.

Reviews.Title: “If you love France, you will love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: penninewalker
Reviews.Content: The Langlois is quintessentially Parisian. Beautiful belle-epoch rooms & bathrooms, large & high-ceilinged, full of character & charm. (I was in 21, I think 11,31 etc are the same). Charming staff too, though with the usual tendency to deploy a Gallic shrug in answer to a question. Faint background rumble from the metro at times, but I would rate this as a quiet hotel with good facilities including aircon, wifi etc .Excellent value, recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful bouique hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: donzero
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very charming and has big rooms ( and bathroom too!) for Paris standard hotels. The breakfast was just right the cost of staying here is very friendly to the pocket! the service is very very nice and the staff accommodating and friendly! Will definitely stay there if i get the chance to visit again and will definitely recommend to anyone who would ask! I'll never forget the charming elevator!

Reviews.Title: “basic french hotel great people”
Reviews.Author: Carriedaway_10
Reviews.Content: Hotel has good location, what I really liked about the hotel was the people at the reception, very sweet, helpful and cheerful!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and helpful staff but beware of pickpockets in the lobby.”
Reviews.Author: bookish42
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It has a great vintage Paris atmosphere, and my room was huge by Paris standards. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Morning room service was incredibly fast and cheerfully delivered, and there is the option to eat breakfast downstairs as well. The location is great -- a little off the beaten tourist path but with lots of restaurants and stores nearby, as well as a Metro stop down the block and the lovely Gustave Moreau Museum around the corner. The RoissyBus service from Charles De Gaulle Airport stops within walking distance from the hotel, which is very convenient. My room faced the back of the hotel and didn't have much of a view, but it was very quiet and peaceful. I thought the price was a bargain, given the excellent service and the size of my room. My sole complaint about the room was that the bed was uncomfortable -- the mattress was too firm without much cushioning. Also, unfortunately I do want to report that my purse was stolen from next to me in the breakfast/computer room just off the lobby. This was definitely not the hotel's fault -- it could happen anywhere. But please watch your valuables carefully when you are in the common areas downstairs. The staff was helpful after this theft occurred. I would still recommend Hotel Langlois to anyone and would stay there again. As a solo female traveler, I felt safe there. My only reason for mentioning it is to warn people that they should be careful with their purses and wallets.

Reviews.Title: “highly recomended”
Reviews.Author: lancelot1978
Reviews.Content: Me & mywife had stayed in the hotel for 5 days in November/2010.First be sure that is over 2 * sup.The rooms and bathrooms sizes are enormous,so clean,24 hour hot water and very satisfying heating system. The hotel is just 30-50 meters to metro.You can find open restaurants and markets till late hours of the day.Also there is a taxi point near hotel if you like.You can go many places by walk.The receptionist can speak english very well.Special for Turkish visitors at nights the receptinists can speak french & english & turkish so! Breakfast is also satisfying; fresh orange juice,egg,2 kinds of chese,olives & olive oil... dont mixed up your minds.if the budget of you fits with this class,you do not need to search more.you can chose this safely...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: mp46
Reviews.Content: This wasn't a honeymoon, strictly speaking, but this was the first time my new wife and I had been to Paris together. I'd stayed at the romantic Langlois once 5 years ago and had fond memories of its quaint decor, eccentric furnishings - and the wacky lift! So I didn't hesitate, and I'm glad I didn't. The place went down a storm with J - the staff were friendly and efficient, the top-floor room was large and comfortable (one star deducted for what seemed like unnecessarily hard pillows, but maybe that's still a French thing), the location was perfect (some great restaurants and the foodie heaven Rue des Martyrs nearby, metro and cab rank just round the corner ). The noisy nights others have complained of seem to be a thing of the past (and we're not particularly heavy sleepers) - not that I remember any noise 5 years ago either. So: recommended to anyone who wants a bit of real Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Grand old dame”
Reviews.Author: jslonisch
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Langlois is a lovely old Belle Epoche style Parisien hotel on the northern side of the Opera district. Rooms are large for Europe (my bathroom in particular was HUGE.) Furniture and pictures are all of that era but bathrooms are modern with fittings that work properly yet are retro style. Street facing rooms have double glazing but would be noisy in hot weather with the windows open I would think. One of the Metro stops (that goes straight to the Montmartre district) is just around the corner, and the hotel is within easy walking distance of the RoissyBus airport shuttle near the Opera. Service was friendly for Paris and the lady at reception who seems to run the place spoke good English and was helpful including making a phone call to secure a dinner reservation for me. Breakfast was not worth the 13 euro price with only a small range of cold food.

Reviews.Title: “Quintessentially Paris”
Reviews.Author: Poophiles
Reviews.Content: Beautifully appointed with tasteful antiques. Plumbing is antiquated and beds a bit Spartan. Wi-fi infuriatingly slow. Modern lift and TV's. Superb location. Nice breakfast and a good value all around. Service is---well---like Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Parisian experience, a wonderful place to stay full stop!”
Reviews.Author: Hucksteau
Reviews.Content: What a hidden gem amongst the streets of Paris, for those people who seek a truly "Paris" experience, this Hotel is a sure winner. We have stayed 3 times over the past 10 years and it just gets better every time, the location is very good if a bit away from "tourist" Paris, (not a problem in my book) Still close enough to enjoy wondering the streets on your way. We will never stay anywhere else in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Old Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bismallw
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth time to stay at the Hotel Langlois. It is away from the hustle and bustle of touristy Paris, but so close that you are only a few blocks away from the Galleries Lafayette and the Opera and other shopping. They provide a variety of foods for breakfast and the staff is very accommodating. My favorite place to stay in Paris - other than an apartment - if I am there for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jesuisvoyageur
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at Hotel Langlois. The room size is pretty big in Paris standard. We have a flat screen TV and separate bath/toilet rooms. The elevator, however, is quite old and sometimes not function properly. The service is great. If you want privacy and tranquility, it's a hotel for you. There aren't good restaurant nearby esp. late night so if you arrive late and are looking for, chances are you might be starving. Service was ok. Staffs are quite friendly.

Reviews.Title: “great value for price - nice with children”
Reviews.Author: Buiting
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in the Hotel Lanlois, with 3 children (age 5 to 9 years). Rooms were large and clean, personnel was very friendly. Location was practical and close enough to the Gare du Nord and the city centre. Venue has the character you would hope to have for a hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VAfrancophile
Reviews.Content: We have been to France a number of times, generally staying on the Left Bank. We decided to stay on the Right Bank the last trip and were looking for a hotel that was also reasonable for Paris. We liked the hotel, although it may have been too far off the beaten path, so I'm not sure we would do it again. We felt as though we weren't quite in Paris, though it is not hard to get to the main sights from the Langlois. The staff was nice, the rooms large for Paris, and clean, so we have no real complaints. I remember reading from other people that it was not a hotel for "first time visitors" and that is probably true, as you are out of the heart of Paris. When we go back, we will either stay closer to the center, the Marais, or the Left Bank again. The Langlois is not far from the Opera, Gallerie Lafayette, and Printemps, so it depends upon what your preferences are. The bed was a little hard, but the rooms were nice, spacious, and probably the greatest deal for the money space-wise. The staff was helpful and friendly. They spoke English, but we're spoiled as our daughter speaks fluent French. The rates at "our Left Bank hotel" had risen considerably, so we tho't we'd try the Langlois. It is certainly a good value for the money and the Metro and train station are nearby.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: gingerkeith
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here three times now and think it the best value hotel in Paris. Service is very good, room size is incredible in comparison with most hotels of this price in the city and I love the very clean but jaded art deco bathrooms which in some instances are actually bigger than bedrooms in other hotels I've stayed in. Great position especially for the Grand Magasins (Gallerie Lafayette a 5 minute walk).

Reviews.Title: “Taste of classic pre-war Paris with all mod-cons”
Reviews.Author: Jol
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Langlois for just one night before flying home. It is an intriguing peaceful place where the old Parisian bourgeois decor has been lovingly kept while adding all the comforts of the present. Our room and bathroom were spacious and comfortable, the staff we met were friendly and helpful, and our courtyard room was very quiet. The elvator is a classic, as is most everything in the building. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Just the Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: QuintessentialTips
Reviews.Content: Our 5th stay over the past 6 years - continues to be a great place, economical, large rooms, pleasant staff, safe area, close to Metro (2 min. walk), open windows (if you like your window open stay on courtyard side). Note construction ongoing next door during Mon-Friday. Hotel is less than 10 minutes from Gare du Nord by taxi. Breakfast is a bit expensive - but you get fresh squeezed orange juice, soft-boil your own eggs, toast, cheese, olives, croissants, etc.. and they will provide room service. Wireless internet in rooms worked very well if you have your own laptop. Will continue to return.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, charming hotel, good room size”
Reviews.Author: Saley69
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel on the basis of Tripadvisor reviews. These were on the money. Location is excellent - a Metro at the corner, Les Grands Magasins in walking distance, but a relatively quiet street outside of the usual tourist areas. Room size was excellent for a Paris hotel. elevator is impractical but fascinating and part of the ambience. Staff friendly and helpful. Free wifi is an additional plus

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel--if location suits”
Reviews.Author: nosaat
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Langlois for a week. Here are my impressions: The hotel itself is charming. The room was large by Paris standards and had most of the amenities that I needed--comfortable bed, fresh linens, a small table with 2 chairs, TV, a minibar and air conditioning. There was no safe. The bathrobe was fairly old-fashioned, but everything worked well and there was a bathtub. The only amenties provided were soap, shampoo and a shower cap (besides towels of course). Both rooms were very clean and kept that way. The staff was excellent. They were very helpful with transportation advice and went out of their way to assist us with whatever we needed. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel, so I cannot comment on that. I did not have a laptop, and tried to access the lobby computer a few times. Unfortunately, the connection was sporadic at best and at times did not work. The telephone connection in my room was also problematic and calls got cut off or weren't able to get through. There is construction work being done next door. The hotel volunteered this information when I first contacted them, so I have no complaints to them. The work would begin about 8:00 am, which you might want to take into account. The location is a plus or minus, depending on how you view it. On one hand, the hotel itself is not really near anything, except perhaps Rue Haussemann and the department stores. The Rue Richer area is a 7-10 minute walk.. On the other hand, many sites are within a 15-30 minute walking range. In addition, there is a Metro station right on the corner , and the Metro system in Paris is truly excellent. You can get almost anywhere within a few minutes. I really enjoyed my stay at the Langlois. Next time I might opt for a different location. But if you are willing to walk a lot (and have the time for it) or spend time on the metro, the Langlois is an excellent option.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, met my expectations”
Reviews.Author: JJinLaCrosse
Reviews.Content: After almost obessesive searching on TA, my daughter (16 years) and I chose this hotel for our 8 night stay in June. We weren't disappointed! It has a charming feel to it even though not immaculately dusted. Our two room suite was perfect for us and gave us a little space after very long days of exploring. The patisserie/boulangerie just down the street from the hotel was excellent and was our first stop every day. I especially enjoyed not being in a traditional tourist area and could better experience Parisien life. For dinner one evening we grabbed sandwiches and sat in near by Trinite park watching children and their parents enjoy the summer evening at the end of the work day.

Reviews.Title: “Felt really like staying in Paris with Fab size room and location”
Reviews.Author: Sweetpeatraveluk
Reviews.Content: Wanted a Parisienne feel to the hotel, do not like the plastic 4/5 stars hotels that could be anywhere in the world.Room 15 was at the front of hotel and with window open loud traffic noise( did not bother us though) with shut no noise at all. In we walked having been in the quaint and tiny lift ( can not believe one of the previous reviewers said it was awful) it was fab ! only on floor one, but used it up and down everytime like little kids ! Door opens into a hall with big mirror and then into a big big bathroom with picture mirror, big old fireplace and tiled floor. The other side into a very large room, with seating area by window, old furniture, very very heavy wood. Mantlepiece above big old fireplace with a woman bust ( showing half of her actual bust if you get my drift) She was lovely just sitting looking over us. I work for a bank and am not a wierdo honest. Anyway, we walked to the Moulin Rouge for a show. Not to be missed 90 euro with no food and drink, but an absolute must and a restaurant up the same hill, 3 mins from hotel call something theatre rest, on the corner. Fab french food. All in all. Great place to stay. Excellent. Thanks Paris for a fab time. Beautiful city I have to say. No bar, and we did not have breakfast. Breakfast room small and functional. Lots of places to eat near by., Very very very expensive Paris "!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our first choice for our next Paris stay!”
Reviews.Author: bigtsur
Reviews.Content: Located on a quiet street, this hotel has 2 names (aka Hôtel des Croisés). We had a fun time taking the small historic elevator up to our huge room with a view of the Sacre Coeur and the Trinity building (see photos), #64. The tub was splendidly big! Decor was historically romantic. Hotel service was great. The location was good, close to shopping and Metro stops. We found a yummy Italian restaurant around the corner, Restaurant dell'Orto. We also found a friendly (English speaking) wine bar called Le Rouge et le Verre, but look for the awing marked Cave a Vins / Tables d'hotes. For the room size, prize and romantic decor, we highly recommend this hotel and hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: c0nny
Reviews.Content: I loved this Hotel...waking in, I liked the individuality of each and every room. You would think antiques make it feel stuffy - not here. The reception desk is friendly, the bathroom is spotless and the room a gem. We had a room right under the roof with a gorgeous view. It is in a quiet side street, but 4 minutes and you were at a Metro stop and l'opera is close by. I was concerned since it was once featured in a movie that it would be too commercial but it isn't. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional parisianne charm and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: TJ2009
Reviews.Content: Merci to all of the staff at the Hotel Langlois for such a wonderful time. OK - many others have described this piece of traditional old world charm (the large rooms, the dated decor, etc) - but not many recounted their contact with the lady of the house, a most charming Madame who also has a great sense of humour, to staff who like to laugh at their lack of English while you laugh at your own lack of French - the people who create the right atmosphere for those with the sensibility to appreciate the opportunity to avoid yet another cloned Western hotel. One of the stars of the hotel has to be the elevator - cosy, not for those who suffer from claustrophobia - but very quiet and efficient. We have just stayed at the Langlois for five nights and thoroughly appreciated every moment of the experience. Unfortunately, the building next door is being renovated and the resulting noise starts early - but, come on, you are here to sightsee and shop, not sleep in late every morning. Our room faced rue Saint Lazare and while not whisper quiet one was not overtly disturbed as long as you kept the double glazed windows closed. The room was impeccably clean, serviced every day, and we were given a non-smoking room as requested. The location of the hotel near some great brasseries and pastry shops, with the Metro station right on the corner, and fantastic shopping within easy walking distance, make this a perfect spot to stop. If you want a great dinner while staying there, try the Villa Victoria (as recommended by the Hotel). We will most definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Review of Hotel Langlois”
Reviews.Author: MarkSt11
Reviews.Content: Bonjour I should have written this earlier. I wouldn't quite rave about the place as much as others but I'd still actively consider returning there. My room was quiet and clean if gloomy. Yes, a certain style. Some electrical problems but these were rectified. Good breakfast. Maddening old lift. My main criticism is that Langlois should get out of the late 20th century and have designated non-smoking rooms. I tried hiding the ashtray, I may do more drastic things on my next visit. I told them politely that they should get their act together here. They were polite but didn't seem responsive. Come on you francais!

Reviews.Title: “Good value outside the tourist area”
Reviews.Author: nycyogini
Reviews.Content: Hotel Langlois is located in a charming old building outside the main tourist area, yet within steps to a Metro stop and cafes and shops frequented by locals, providing a taste of life in Paris. This was perfect for us, as we have been to Paris multiple times, but I would probably not recommend staying in this area on a first trip. It is also located close to the train station, which is ideal as we took the Eurostar from London. We had requested one of the rooms with a view of Sacre Cour, but unfortunately this request was not met, though no guarantee was made by the hotel. Our room did not have a view, but it was immense by Paris standards, as was the bathroom, with large ceilings adding to the spaciousness. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel, as there are many lovely cafes and brasseries within walking distance. Hotel Langlois is a good value, and we would stay again, crossing our fingers for one of the coveted rooms with a view!

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: kristaotis09
Reviews.Content: This quaint hotel made my trip to Paris! As a single female traveler I never once felt nervous in the area. The staff was very helpful, rooms were spotless and quite large for a Paris hotel. There was even a bathtub! My room was facing the street, and I never had a problem with noise. The location is what made this perfect though, right next to an awesome bakery, and next to that a cafe, which made breakfast easy and cheap. Just around the corner was a metro stop, and it only took a few minutes to get to the heart of Paris. Would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: busbyingeneva
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Langlois just after the New Year and had a great experience. We are a family of three (two adults and one nine-year-old boy) and have become accustomed to very cramped hotel rooms in Paris. The room for three we had at the Langlois was palatial in comparison. Large double bed (king size) and plenty of room for a cot. The bathroom was also gigantic; it appeared to have been converted out of a regular sized room. (Don't know whether this is true for all the triple rooms, but you might ask.) High ceilings as well, so we really had a sense of spaciousness all around. At the same time, the decor of the hotel has just the sort of charm one expects in Paris -- beautiful carved wooden decorations and an old fashioned caged elevator that actually worked. Some of the furnishings in the room were a bit drab, as is the breakfast area, but these can be tolerated. The hotel also provides free computer access downstairs, which is a rarity for a two-star hotel these days. Finally, when we paid our bill (150 euros per night for the the three of us -- not bad), they retroactively gave us a discount of 15 euros per night as they had decided to reduce their rates for the period we were there after we had booked our room. Such honesty is almost unheard of! The staff was also extremely accommodating. The only slight downside of the hotel is its location -- a little bit away from some of the central attractions. But the metro stop is very close by (Trinite), and there are plenty of cafes and restaurants in the area. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a reasonably priced option in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy Here!”
Reviews.Author: geordy
Reviews.Content: Made a decision to stay on the right bank last trip and this hotel seemed perfect. Good reviews, centralish location..okay the Movie background! It is a small , lovely hotel in a very old building. Our room was one of the largest I've had in Paris and it was just a standard double bed room with bath. Interesting furnishings and details. I always insist on A/C in Sept. but only needed it the first afternoon...and that was only because we were actually in the hotel in the afternoon because we were not able to check in until after one. The staff were all efficient, the elevator tiny but fortunarely working as we were on the 5th flooy(though we often walked down), did not take breakfast as there are plenty of cafes and such in the area. Very convenient if you are there for shopping, the Opera.... A little out of the way for first timers..I'd stay closer to the Seine if a Paris newbie, but Metro and taxi stand right around the corner, as well as 3 cafes that are open even on Sunday, cash machines, stores for wine, water, snacks... Had a view of the tippy top of Sacre Coeur and Paris rooftops! No complaints! And the price is right! I won't say too much more...don't want the rates to increase! And now I have to rent the Movie!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Paris hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AMSTravels
Reviews.Content: Gosh, this must be the nicest hotel in Paris for the price! Lovely big rooms, comfortable bed, lots of light. Heavenly.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Older Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dklaw
Reviews.Content: Hotel Langlois is a classic older and smaller hotel, with all of the uniqueness and charm that you might expect. The lobby looks like it came out of a movie set, and there is a wire-cage lift for moving luggage up and down. (The wide stairway is perfectly adequate for walking.) We had a spacious room and bathroom on the front side of the hotel. There is some traffic noise if you leave the windows open, but generally things seemed to quiet down after midnight, at least on the weeknights. The hotel is conveniently located next to the Trinite Metro station, and there is a good bakery nearby, as well as several cafes and bistros. However, if you are planning to visit the major tourist attractions (Eiffel Tower, des Invalides, Museums, etc.), you may want to look for a hotel on the other side of the river, as it can be a bit of a walk. The neighborhoods around the Langlois are a mix of apartments and night clubs (Moulin Rouge is not too far away), which is a plus if you are looking to experience the real Paris rather than the typical tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Hotel Langlois & Paris!!!”
Reviews.Author: JerseyBeachcomber
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on many great reviews here on Tripadvisor. We were quite happy with our choice. A quaint, hundred year old hotel with good service, nice rooms, and a convenient location in a good neighborhood. If you want a closer look at the hotel, watch the DVD of the Jonathan Demme film, "Truth About Charlie", the remake of "Charade". We are a middle aged couple, travelling by train from London, to the Gare du Nord station nearby. A perfect trainride. Be sure to take a taxi to the hotel. The suites and rooms are large by Paris standards. The antique elevator that you will use makes you feel like you are in an old french movie. Be a good rider, and close the gates when you get off, so it can move for the next rider. We experienced good service, and assistance from the desk. Try Le Bistro des Deux Theatres for a great meal. It's a quick walk from the hotel. It was so good, we returned on our last night in Paris. Early morning you will wake up to the smells coming up from the bakery next door. Wow---I miss those croissants. English is widely spoken. Whenever, I had slight problems with my lack of French, I would just smile, and have fun. Stay at the Langlois, and have a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: divin1
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Meridien Etoile for a couple nights as part of a tour, we were thrilled to move to another area and this Hotel Langlois. Of course, it's a small, boutique hotel (vs. the 1,000 room Meridien) and older but that's what makes it charming. We stayed on the 6th floor, room 62 which had a king bed, tv, sitting area, non-working fireplace and nice large, clean bathroom with tub and shower. Windows opened out to the interior side of the building so we heard no street noise. We found the staff to be very helpful, ordering us a taxi the night before we left for the airport and even allowing us to use their office computer to print our boarding passes as some other guest was hogging the free internet in the lobby and wouldn't give us a chance. Hotel is walking distance to Moulin Rouge, Montmartre, Sacre Coeur, the Opera, etc. Also recommend trying the two day "hop-on, hop-off" bus for about E$22. It goes around to all the places you want to see, Eiffel Tower, Louvre, Notre Dame, Arch de Triomphe, etc. You can pick it up at a short walk by the Opera and it includes headsets with multi-language choice tour info.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Paris stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelerHouston_TX
Reviews.Content: Rooms were large, as advertised, although furnishings were very dated. Location is convenient to METRO Front desk staff not particularly helpful, in fact refusing to call a taxi at a different time then initially requested. We were unable to obtain our own taxi, since we learned that cab drivers require call from hotel. Failure to change pick-up time caused delay in reaching train.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: seegage
Reviews.Content: Following research on TA, I booked Hotel Langlois for a two night stay. Away from Paris Central meant affordable prices both for hotel and local restaurants. Generous room size with seperate washroom, TV and Air-con. Wi-Fi if you need it, but I deliberately left my laptop at home. Room was at front and could be a bit noisy at night, noisy in the day too at the moment due to building work but that is a temporary situation. Metro stop barely 100 metres away and the Paris Metro system doesn't take long to get used to - even for two days our €16 Orange cards were well worth it. If you prefer walking, its not so far out to be impractical - we walked back from the Louvre at 1am with no problem, though it pays to have some idea where you are going... Don't expect superlative service or fancy hotel procedures - what you see it what you get and we were not disaapointed, with the exception of breakfast which is best taken at one of the cafés round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but possibly over-priced”
Reviews.Author: Whitechurch
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Langlois is a charming, comfortable and clean hotel with helpful staff. The only major downsides were the price and the noise (but only during the working day) from the very extensive renovations being carried out next door. It is conveniently located very near Trinite Metro station and plenty of eateries for anything from a quick coffee & croissant in the morning to a full evening meal. The furniture was very solid and traditional -- as was the plumbing in the bathroom which was as large as many a hotel bedroom. The lift has period charm but saves walking up many flights of stairs. Our room overlooked a central courtyard so we were not exposed to any traffic noise. The price was noticeably higher than the equally-convenient hotel which has just been refurbished (also a 2-star) that we have previously used in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little hotel”
Reviews.Author: tweeter_23
Reviews.Content: This was a really nice little hotel, and a pretty good value considering that it is near the heart of Paris and is just a block from a Metro stop. The staff speaks enough English to help you with just about anything you need, and they are very friendly besides. Can't beat the free (and fast) internet in the breakfast room - so much better than having to search for internet cafes while you're out touring during the day. Our room was great - pretty architectural details and a beautiful view of the Sacre Coeur church. The bathroom was tiny, but everything was clean and they had complimentary soap, shampoo, and conditioner. I'd say that the only drawback is that the housekeeping staff are really noisy in the morning, so it's hard to sleep in past about 9:00, although most days we were up by that time anyway. Overall I'd say that this one is a good pick for travelers looking for a good deal on a very pleasant stay in Paris. Also, their tiny elevator is a little scary looking, but don't be afraid to try it - it works great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Meaculpal
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hotel Langlois in June 2008 for one night. We had been on an organized tour, and we wanted to stay in a hotel that was both reasonably priced and centrally located. This hotel fit the bill. The hotel is located within a few feet of the Trinte Metro stop, and it is close to several nice cafes and restaurants. One of the nice things about its location is that it is only a ten minute walk to the Roissey Bus to CDG. I would like to thank the entire staff at the hotel for a pleasant stay. The room was a good size, and the prices for the minibar were extremely reasonable. The room was also extremely quiet. The only complaint we had was the extremely hard bed, but that was minor compared to our overall good experience. I would recommend this property to anyone looking for a good location with good value.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: pmhuk
Reviews.Content: Tho only a 2 star had high expectations of this place based on previous TripAdvisor reviews. We stayed for 2 nights. Room was dreary and rather like hospital with drab walls. We were on the 1st floor directly above reception and smoke seemed to find its way into the room. I found the staff v unhelpful. For example, I asked someone on reception if it was possible to buy a 1-day travelcard for the metro. They didn't know. Hmmmm. Breakfast v poor for the money. Basic continental and not good quality. The hotel is not that cheap. Those searching for somewhere slightly quirky and full of character should look elsewhere. Avoid!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dartmouthgirl
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Hotel Langlois for two nights in May. My husband and I travelled with our four and-a-half year-old daughter. The location was perfect: two minutes' walk from the Metro, 5 minutes from fabulous shopping. There are cafes on the corner. The hotel provided a cot for our daughter at no extra charge. The room was charming and spacious enough. There was a mini fridge and a TV. Our room was on the fifth floor. Noise was not a problem. There was an ancient lift from the ground level that was small but worked just fine. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel. It was about 12 euros per person, which was very high. Much cheaper -- and more fun -- to eat at one of the cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: rcasi
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is outstanding. The metro station is not more than 100 meters and there are may bus stops near by. The hotel itself is on a quiet street and one note is that there is construction going on on both sides of the hotel so there is a bit of noise but only in normal hours. The hotel has a lot of charm and for me was quiet beautiful. There is free wifi, plus a computer on the first floor that is free to use for guest to surf the internet. The management were very nice with us, and provided us with great service. The hotel has a small lift, but is was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “the Lovely Langlois”
Reviews.Author: baronessa23
Reviews.Content: I chose this property because of the good rates, good reviews, and the pictures of the bathrooms and views. While our room didn't end up having a view (we didn't request it either) the bathroom was fabulous with oversized green pedestal sink and matching tub. French doors separated the bathroom from the bedroom. And while we didn't have a view of the street or rooftops, the courtyard was also terribly 'French' with European charm pouring from every corner. Cannot comment on the breakfast as we never bothered to try it. It smelled awfully good but we were always too much in a hurry to hit the streets or sleeping late. The staff is very friendly and helpful. When we asked for directions they were very eager to offer the best route and warn us of the distance. The neighborhood is lovely with shopping, restaurants and attractions within easy walking distance and the metro just a block or so away. Wonderful experience and would return without a doubt. PS - my boyfriend is very particular and the only thing he would suggest is that if you use a washcloth regularly take them or ask for them. We didn't ask for them so are unsure if this is something that can be obtained on request.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not great”
Reviews.Author: torsk
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice rooms and good bed. However, the soundproofing (between rooms) was way below average. Breakfast was OK (not included in rate). Our total impression would benefit from more courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovestotap
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Lanlois and thoroughly enjoyed it. The price was very reasonable, at the time, and the hotel and our room were very clean. The bathroom was very nice, and the room was spacious enough. All European hotel rooms are rather small; but, our room did not make us feel claustrophobic. We also found the staff to be very friendly. The elevator is a very tight squeeze, if you have an overabundance and oversized luggage. You may have to make a couple of trips. I would not only reccommend this hotel; but, would also stay again and again on subsequent visits.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, it is full of french charm!”
Reviews.Author: Purdita76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a lovely, quite, hotel, near the attractions and at a good price. We were not disappointed. The lift in the reception is just gorgeous as was our room, number 24. We didint eat breakfast at the hotel but it looked very nice. We walked to everywhere from the hotel but treated ourselves to a cab to get back! We really enjoyed our time in Paris. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Langlois is PARFAIT!”
Reviews.Author: christsjoy
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel after reading the reviews and checking out the location and were extremely happy with our decision. Coming back to the hotel after a full day of viewing the sites, was like coming home. It's so quaint and comfortable. Our room was #63 which has a HUGE BED and wonderful view. [We've posted some pictures]. The breakfast room is beautiful and the breakfast was incredible for the price! It was all we needed to get us going for the day! Fresh yogurt, fruit, cereal, milk, several kinds of cheese, meat, eggs to boil, toast, croissants, rolls, coffee, juice. It was an all you could eat buffet! We're going to stay there whenever we visit Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Authenticity at its best”
Reviews.Author: Andrews68
Reviews.Content: Excellent location just seconds from Metro (Trinite). Hotel down quiet street just off busy square. Lovely building. Very inviting reception. Traditional Parisian lift. We went for a standard double (on 5th floor) which was at the rear of the hotel so very peaceful. A lovely authentic, large bedroom. Big, comfortable bed. Bathroom basic but clean and in good working order. Cleaners keep the rooms in top condition. Did not have breakfast as did the cafes but at 12 euros it seems reasonable in comparison to elsewhere. Had sneaky look at a superior bedroom located at front of hotel; definitely worth the extra 20 euros a night. Can't believe it's only a 2 star!!

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay Just as Good as First”
Reviews.Author: utahskier
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four night stay the Langlois. We stayed in Room 11 which featured a giant bathroom with large tub and enclosed WC, but no view. Our friends stayed in Room 64 which has a small bathroom but a great view of Sacre Coeur. The staff was helpful in arranging dinner reservations. We took the Roissy Bus and walked to the hotel. Some restaurant ideas. The Pommerai restaurant across the street was quite pleasant. Be warned that they speak little english, however. We enjoyed Cafe Des Musees near the Picasso Museum as well as Robert et Louise in the Marais. Reservations in Paris are necessary for dinner. Also this time we purchased the paris museum pass which allowed us to cut lines (very long) at Versailles, Louvre, and The Orangerie Museum. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: rebonjour
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Langlois is a charming hotel with a friendly and helpful staff. We always seem to have a lot of questions and we appreciated the extra help that the staff were able to give us. The rooms are large and the bathrooms are big and very clean. We thought the beds were very comfortable. There is a lovely breakfast room with an excellent buffet each morning ( for an additional charge ). We loved the vintage elevator with the wooden and iron doors. A metro stop, cash machine. post office, bakery, restaurants and laundromat are all a few steps to a few blocks away. Several big department stores are also within walking distance. And...there's a computer in the breakfast room that is available for guests beginning at 11:00 in the morning. We have stayed there on 3 separate occasions and had an excellent experience each and every time. We will DEFINITELY recommend the Hotel Langlois to friends and we hope to be able to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a very nice location”
Reviews.Author: apfelwein
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely old hotel in an interesting part of Paris. The reception staff were very friendly. A quaint old elevator takes you up to your room. The room themselves were decorated with antiques and the room we had a nice view over the rooftops of the district. We could see the pretty church (Trinitate if I remember correctly) and the Sacre Coeur. The area is nice with a couple of Brasseries and restaurants. The huge department stores are within walking distance. Cross the road and go up the hill to walk to Pigalle and Montmartre (not a long walk). There are some really nice cafés and restaurants on the way up. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy choice for Paris”
Reviews.Author: IndyBee
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenage daughter and I stayed here for two nights. Our room and bathroom were nice sized, large by Parisian standards, and the bathroom was enormous and well appointed. The proprietress was very helpful in assisting us with reservations, Metro advice, maps, etc. They have a computer available for guest use in the lounge. Excellent location - very close to Trinite metro, and several other Metro stops, include Gare Lazare and Gare du Nord. Also, easy 15-20 minute walk or very quick cab ride from where the Roissy Bus drops you off. The neighborhood is a little dead on the weekend compared to the Left Bank, but very lively during the week. Easy walk to Louvre. We will definitely stay at the Langlois again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Langlois - c'est magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: sandyjmacdonald
Reviews.Content: Getting to the hotel couldn't be easier - just grab a Metro to Trinite and the hotel is literally about one minute's walk away (it's in the 9th arrondissement, fairly close to Montmartre). The hotel itself is quite old fashioned, but not in a dusty, dingy way; the owners have obviously taken great care in decorating it with impressionist style paintings and marble statues to bring out the old charm of the hotel. The lift has to be seen to be properly appreciated - I won't say much more on that. Our room was well equipped with a comfortable bed, quite a large LCD TV, wardrobe and minibar. The beds were clean and extremely comfortable, especially after a long day tramping about Paris. The bathroom was perhaps the only minor gripe that I could make. It was quite cramped, but provided the necessary I suppose - bath, shower, wash-hand basin and toilet. Any minor gripes were extinguished by the view from our window (on the sixth floor). Straight ahead, Sacre Couer could be seen on top of La Butte, whilst to the left was Trinite church. It was great watching the sun set behind that glorious view. Service from the staff was friendly and efficient. The maids kept the room spick and span, and the reception staff were happy to entertain our slightly rusty French and help us out in English when required. Breakfast comprised a fairly comprehensive buffet with cereal, croissants, pain au chocolat, tea, coffee, boiled eggs, bread and various jams, cheese and ham, oh and orange juices and water. There was also complimentary internet in the breakfast room between 11am and late All in all, a thoroughly enjoyable stay at Hotel Langlois - I couldn't praise it highly enough. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: rjjb
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect place for our too-short three-day stay in Paris. The room was lovely and more than adequate in size (for three adults). It was actually two rooms in one. Charming ambience, pleasant helpful staff, clean, great location for Metro, and reasonable priced. Recommended without qualification.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: travelpal79
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay! The hotel was cute! Charming elevator (if small), charming room (if small). The location was great - about a block to the subway station which made for easy access getting around town. The internet access in the lounge was appreciated. I wouldn't recommend paying for the breakfast -- overpriced for what it was. Venture out to one of the nearby cafes for a better experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: hmhmhm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights recently in a double room with bathroom. I specified in my email booking that I would prefer a room on a higher floor and this was granted. Our room didn't have much of a view, but it was very large (I think there was enough space for 2 small rooms!) and was very comfortable. The bathroom was a bit funny shaped and while it wasn't exactly dirty, it could have been cleaner and was the least clean out of all the places we stayed at during our holiday. The location is GREAT! It is a 5 to 10 minute walk to the main department stores and 10 to 15 minutes to the Moulin Rouge. The man at reception also recommended a good restaurant for us to go to the night we got there - I think it was called '2 theatres' or something. Overall, about 4 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Good for kids”
Reviews.Author: EJaneWench
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a suite (#44, I think) with our 3 children from June 12 through June 15. The hotel was clean and comfortable and the staff friendly. The kids (ages 7, 8 and 13) loved the elevator. We opted out of the hotel breakfast (only because our children do not eat 8 euros worth), but there is a wonderful bakery next door for breakfast pastries which we ate in the suite with coffee ordered up from the hotel (at a very reasonable price). The only downside is that the location is not the most convenient for the major tourist attractions. The Musee D'Orsay is only 3 or 4 Metro stops away, and from there we could take the BatoBus around to the sights on the Seine during the day, but returning back to the hotel from the Eiffel Tower at night (after 9 when the BatoBus shuts down) was difficult by Metro, requiring 2 transfers, so we convinced a taxi driver to let the 5 of us squeeze into his cab. Overall, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: cow_manx
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great combination of charming history, free WiFi, and location. Very nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “What an Oasis!”
Reviews.Author: southerntraveler1989
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights recently. It was great --- A/C, a lift (very quaint), nice helpful staff, great location for sightseeing and restaurants (and shops). We highly recommend this hotel (but take your own hairdryer). The room decor was very nice too.

Reviews.Title: “The lovely Langlois”
Reviews.Author: Tennisnut4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights in early June. Picked it because it was in The Guardian or The Observer paper review of top 20 hotels in Paris for under £100. It lived up to its selection. We noted French people were staying here as well as tourists. Hotel is on a quiet street; we had a rear room so no street noise. However, the hotel is situated above the metro lines so trains can be heard rumbling by underneath. This didn't bother us in sleeping as it is a far away rumble. The hotel has 24 rooms; all the stairways and floors are carpeted so again no footfall noise. Good standard of decoration, think red carpets and plush curtains with quirky light fittings. Comfy beds, good size rooms, very very friendly staff. Breakfast 11 euros - freshly squeezed orange juice is included or go to the patisserie along the street. We had the breakfast. Good location by Trinitie metro and its in the vicinity of the department stores.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gaelic999
Reviews.Content: We both stayed at the hotel im May for a "special Birthday". The location of the hotel is ideal for exploring Paris. You are about 10 minutes walk from the Opera and all the sights beyond that. Hotel: The hotel is "old world paris" with its fireplaces and antiques in the bedrooms. The lift is amazing with it's iron frame and heavy wood interior. The hotel is on a very quiet street, but really has no views of the Parisian skyline. The staff speak some English, and are willing to help and offer guidance when prompted. We had breakfast in the hotel one morning which was very good. Locality: The hotel is right on the trinity Metro line which provides access to the whole of Paris. We purchased the 10 ticket deal which was ideal for our 3 day stay (tickets are so so cheap!!) . There are plenty of little restaurants close by the hotel with decent food. We went to the 6th floor restaurant for breakfast at La Fayette which was excellent and had superb views of Paris. Sights: We bought a two day open top bus pass, which was superb...1st time we have done this in a city. Some of the sights look close, but are a bit of a distance on foot. The bus is ideal as you can get on and off as often as you like over the two days. You can also add in a riverboat cruise to the ticket. We didn't fid it at all expensive, but ran out of time for the boat cruise. Tickets are valid for two years so we will be back! Dining: There is no smoking ban in Paris, so coming from Scotland we found the smoking in restaurants very unpleasant. I would say do your research on restaurants and try to book in advance, don't rely on finding somewhere nice for that evening as you will probable end up in a tourist restaurant. Watch out many of the cafe's and restaurants all offer the same menu. We had two meals one excellent and the other the best meal ever. We dined in the Juiles Verne restaurant on the second floor of the Eiffel Tour. We couldn't fault it and the meal was first class. It was such a romantic venue and the view over Paris was amazing. It was very expensive - so ideal for special occasions. Overall the hotel made a very comfortable, ideally located base to explore Paris. We would most certainly use this hotel the next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: charlisays
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in February for a weekend with my boyfriend and couldnt have wished for a lovelier hotel. Its very 'oldy-worldy' and very Parisian, it really feels steeped in history. Small but parctical and incredibly clean bathroom, big comfortable bed and antique furniture, on a really quiet street. I would reccomend it for couples and woudl definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nanzan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found this hotel through tripadvisor. We were very pleased with it overall. We had a double and upgraded to a larger double that costed 130 Euro, per night. Everything was clean and wonderful the room looked out over the street. We passed on the breakfast and had a capaccino and bread at the cafe on the corner near the hotel. The hotel is very close to the metro and in a fairly quite part of Paris. There is construction going on down the street but with your windows closed you cannot really hear much. We had no complaints about the hotel and will for sure stay there again when we come to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel that grows on you”
Reviews.Author: TravellerMO
Reviews.Content: After reading many uniformly good reviews on TripAdvisor, we decided to stay at the Hotel Langlois on our holiday in Paris in March 2007. Located on a narrow street close to the Opera, the frontage of the hotel onto the street is so small one could easily walk past it and not notice. When we (wife, daughter and self), first saw the hotel, we were a bit taken aback. We have, over the years been used to staying in big, modern hotels in various countries, so this came as a bit of a surprise. The hotel is very old and has a storied history, so do not be surprised if you are initially disappointed - as we were - by the small and seemingly shabby reception area. The lift, off to one side of this small lobby, is very small too – sort of an an iron cage that creaks its way up and down slowly!! This too, is clearly a vintage contraption. We were greeted at the reception by a very friendly young lady who quickly checked us in. We were given a suite, facing the street. As I mentioned, the hotel is old and has the same old style architecture and layout till today, so when we walked in to our suite – such as it was – we felt let down. The room was old, as was the furniture. We continued to feel disappointed. But as we spent some more time in the room we realized that contrary to initial appearance, it was very clean. The bedlinen was clean and the bathroom was fairly large and very clean. The towels were fresh and white. The room heater worked very well The maids came in daily to clean the rooms, change linen etc. The limited breakfast served in the dining room on the ground floor was also quite good. The best part of the hotel is the location. The Paris underground is fabulous and there is a station just a couple of minutes down the street from the hotel. Since it is in the Opera district, it is pretty centrally located and close to many attractions. The Hop – On, Hop – Off Paris bus tour stop is about a ten minute walk away and there are any number of very good restaurants and cafes within a five to ten minute walk in any direction from the hotel. The staff at the reception were always friendly and helpful and ever ready to offer us advice on “touristy” activities in Paris. I can confidently say that we did not have a single bad experience with the hotel during our stay – absolutely nothing to complain about at all. So if you are looking for a great little hotel centrally located in Paris, this could well be it. Charming, cozy and friendly, Langlois is a hotel that grows on you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value at this friendly, quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: eatigs
Reviews.Content: Our family (young couple and one-year-old child) stayed at the Hotel Langlois for four nights, Feb.25-28, 2007. We very much enjoyed our stay and would happily recommend the hotel to all value-conscious travellers. (We'd give it a rating of 4.5 if we could...) The hotel, a renovated bank from the 1800s, has considerable character and both the reception and cleaning staff are warm and accomodating (although some have limited English). Our room (#55) was very spacious and pleasantly, if simply decorated. The baby cot we had requested was set up while we were checking in, so that it was ready when we moved in. If we leaned out the bathroom window, we could see the Trinity church nearby - about the best view possible, given the hotel's location on a narrow side street. The antique (original?) elevator is a real adventure: it is attractively oak-panneled with an open swinging door but is extremely small and lurches frighteningly when it stops, often at the wrong floor. We found it great fun, but it is clearly the bane of the staff's existence and would be very unsuitable for those who are nervous, claustrophobic or mobility-impaired. As far as advantages, the hotel's location is good, quiet and yet very close to a metro station. The free internet access in the breakfast room is a real plus (although the wireless access is unreliable). We did not eat at the hotel, but the breakfast buffet looked nice and twice the staff thoughtfully gave our baby a fresh croissant when we left in the morning. I liked their key system: each time you leave, you drop your pass key off at reception and the 24-hour desk attendant welcomes you and returns it when you arrive back - no lost keys and the cleaning staff knows when your room is empty. The mini-bar prices were better than most of those in the local shops, so we drank very many bottled waters and juices and then were only charged for a few. They also found us an adapter to allow us to charge our cell phone. For 130 euro a night, we found this hotel to be a great value. The highlight for us was the pleasant, family atmosphere - the staff were unfailingly friendly and eager to help.

Reviews.Title: “3rd Time Staying Here!”
Reviews.Author: Steve2006Dublin
Reviews.Content: My wife, my three children and myself have stayed at Hotel langlois now on three occasions in the past three years. This time we had a suite on the 4th Floor - 42. This hotel cannot be beaten for value for money, ambience and location. We have always found the staff very friendly and professional without being intrusive. The breakfast has gone up to €11 each, but, is still great value and useful when with kids. This time our youngest (8 years old) could walk everywhere! The Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, even the Eiffel Tower and Left Bank were all manageable. As regards shopping, well, the main shops (Printemps, Galleries Lafayette, GAP) are literally two blocks away. We also got out without the kids to the very atmospheric Bistro des Deux Theatres, just around the corner at the side of Trinite Church. 3 Course meal with coffees PLUS a choice of a bottle of wine at €34 each was great value. The Trinite Metro stop is 200m away. There is a superb pattisserie on the same street for stashing up with lunchtime rolls and pastries. Some good Italian restaurants also nearby. One suggestion, if travelling from CDG Airport. Take the train to Gare De Nord and the metro from Magenta (next to Gare De Nord) to Gare St Lazare, from where you can take the 10min walk to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: DublinCb
Reviews.Content: I really cannot fault this hotel; we stayed in room 64, and i loved the decor of this room, and the entire building. Very pleasant staff, and a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money, but too many stairs!!!”
Reviews.Author: xjgrl
Reviews.Content: Hotel Langlois was recommended to me by a good friend who had been intrigued by the hotel after walking by. I reserved a single room via the hotel's website. I arrived at the hotel at 8am on a Tuesday morning and was actually able to check in at that time -- thankfully since I had just been on an 8 hour flight from Africa! Unfortunately for me, the only available room was on the 6th floor -- and the elevator was broken!!!!! Not wanting to wait several hours for a cat nap, I accepted the room on the 6th floor and lugged my luggage up the stairs. Wow -- thats a lot of stairs!! The room was clean, comfortable and had a great view of the city. The elevator remained out of service throughout my 2-night stay -- so I definitely worked off my nutella crepes and croissants!! I did not partake in breakfast at the hotel -- 11 euro seemed a bit steep for breakfast. There are plenty of cafes surrounding the hotel and Rue de Martyre is full of fresh food stands!! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a bargain in a unique part of town. Just make sure to get a room on a lower floor -- just in case the elevator breaks!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for kids”
Reviews.Author: TassPerth
Reviews.Content: We thought this hotel was well located and good value for money. Our triple room was very spacious with an enormous bathroom. Unfortunately we overlooked a very dismal void between buildings, but i'm sure the rooms facing the road are better. Our teenagers had a very pleasant room on the ground floor beside reception looking out onto a pretty courtyard (at the bottom of the dismal void) The ancient lift was a novelty, and some of the bumps and lurches were as good as the Disney rides (I notice another review where the lift is not working!) With regard to the location which as your other reviews have pointed out is excellent for transport and shopping, i should also mention that at the end of the street in front of the Eglise de la Trinite there is a childrens playground, where i spent some time everday with my 7 year old letting off steam after sightseeing. It was fun watching the nannies and their immaculately dressed charges. The playground had an outdoor tabletennis table, and i asked at reception if they had any bats and a ball, which they didn't (wouldn't cost much!) The staff were helpful and my only criticism would be breakfast, which is uncomfortably cramped, and guests have to squeeze past each other to get to the buffet table.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zoidberg-7
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in november and was pleased, if I go back to Paris I'll stay at the Langlois. This is a great hotel in a wonderful location. Only about 1 block to the Metro. The room/bathroom is very big and charming. The staff is very helpful and the hotel is kept clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Nana_H
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based upon the reviews of Tripadvisor.com. The location is perfect, a few steps away from Les Galleries Lafayette (which is open until 10), Printemps and l'Opera. The room is very clean though nothing special really. The lady behind the desk gave us a room on the 5th floor while the elevator didn't work, that was the only negative thing I can say about this hotel. The price is okay compared to other hotels in Paris. I would book it again (though only if given a room on the 1st or 2nd floor).

Reviews.Title: “If you want a Paris hotel that feels Parisian...”
Reviews.Author: tangerine74
Reviews.Content: I booked a double room at the hotel Langlois after reading positive reviews on Trip Advisor, and on the whole, was pretty pleased with what we got. Our room (31) was big, with a large bathroom, and while the decor erred on the vintage side of chic, the old furnishings gave the place a great deal of character, often missing from anonymous city hotels. Big double bed (but small pillows), lots of hot water, TV, wardrobe - and we didn't have a problem with noise from other rooms at all. And as other reviews have mentioned, the old-fashioned lift and the helpful French staff make it a characteristically Parisian experience. Location is very good, about 2 minutes' walk from Trinite metro station, and the Metro itself is as easy to navigate as the London underground. Montmartre is just a few stops north, and it takes no time to get to the major central attractions. We skipped breakfast in the hotel in favour of nearby cafes or boulangeries, of which there are plenty. Downsides? Make sure you bring your own toiletries, or buy some from the Monoprix nearby: the soaps and shampoo sachets are really horrible, stingy offerings, and there's not even a facecloth. Our room was freshly cleaned when we arrived, but it did smell very pungently of fragranced cleaning products, to the point where we had to leave the windows open during the day, just to air the place - if you're a non-smoker with sensitive nose, ask for a non-smoking room!

Reviews.Title: “Sigh...I wish I was still there”
Reviews.Author: alexp1963
Reviews.Content: We arrived early October and planned to stay six nights.It was the last leg of a very long holiday, 2 months in all. Arrived at CDG airport and decided to be adventurous (for us anyway) and got a train to Paris. Silly move in hindsight especially when you have two kids(8 and 13), two adults and too muych luggage and you have no idea how the train system works. Eventually go to the hotel with the help of a local and checked in. Staff were very nice, no issues at all. Went up to our room (24) and were quite surprised. It was a very nice room. Note that the lift (elevator) only fits one person and two suitcases so you may have to do two or three trips to get all your stuff up if you are a family. Anyway we wanted to do some laundry and found a laundromat up the street (turn right when u leave the hotel, approx 300 metres). Along the same route before u get to the laundromat is a small shop where u can buy lots of other necessities, milk shampoo, fruit etc. For breakfast we had hot chocolate and and some croissants that I bought from the two bakeries nearby. We had that same breakfast for fourdays in a row, we just loved it.....on the fourth day the staff gave us some extra hot choc. and juice....they were very very nice. As for the sleeping arrangements, our kids slept on two fold out beds which were quite good, better than they looked. The hotel exceeded our expectations. The location is perfect (near the Metro), the staff were very good and I wish I was still there........PS: We are from Melb. Australia. If anyone wants to ask specific questions email me and we can chat.

Reviews.Title: “Langlois revisited”
Reviews.Author: Aprilfool1965
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a girlie weekend with my sister and friend in Paris and booked the Langlois again. This time around we had a suite which was really spacious. We loved the hotel as it has character and you really feel you are living like a Parisian. The room and bathroom were very clean and the towels are fluffy. Despite the cold weather the hotel was cosy and warm. The hotel is so near the metro that you can travel anywhere in the city very quickly. Of course, it's proximity to Galeries Lafayette and the shopping area didn't influence our choice of hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Langlois”
Reviews.Author: JPatrick91
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Langlois from November 3rd to November 8th. I selected the hotel from it's positive reviews on TripAdvisor and I can tell you that we were very happy with the choice. This being our first trip to Europe, we have nothing to compare it to, but being very typical Americans, we had plenty of room and the bathroom was large. The thermostat was a remote control (have not seen this in the US). The front desk people were very helpful. The breakfast nook was warm and inviting with a computer set up for internet. The hotel, on a quiet street, was well located a half block from the Metro Station Trinite. My sister, who traveled with us, was without her main suitcase for 4 days due to an airline snafu. The hotel staff was so sympathetic to her and and there were hugs as we checked out. Nice people running a quality hotel in the 9th arrondisement in Paris. We already want to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel and a great 2* choice”
Reviews.Author: gmc2508
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Langlois following the favourable reviews from Trip Advisor and I was not disappointed. For a 2 star hotel, the service and room were very pleasant indeed. On checking in, I was given the key to room 23 and took the elevator to the 2nd floor with a heavy case. (Tip - remember to close the interior elevator door on entering and leaving!). The room was a double, facing towards the Rue Sainte-Lazare. The bed was very large and two square pillows were provided, as well as a long bolster-style pillow (which I didn't find terribly comfortable but perhaps others will!).The room comprised a double mirrored-wardrobe, television, small refridgerator, three wicker chairs, a guest table, two bedside tables. In one corner was a marble fire-surround/radiator grill upon which sat a marble bust in front of a large mirror. The room was also air-conditioned (optional, and controllable in the room), and had a small balcony/French windows looking into the street. The bathroom was compact and not terribly well-lit, but had a hair-dryer, shower/bath, toilet, sink and shaver point next to a mirror. The housekeeping at the hotel was not intrusive but the rooms were well-maintained. The staff at the reception desk were helpful and friendly throughout my stay from the 18th-24th October. I did not take breakfast in the hotel as several other options were available nearby, including a patisserie on the same street. The location of the hotel was good for sightseeing, given the proximity to the Metro line 12 station Trinite and also the Gare St Lazare for other lines, including that to Versailles. My one (very small) negative comment is that although the hotel has one computer terminal with internet access in the breakfast room, I would have appreciated free wifi in the rooms, and would have probably paid a little more for the room, was the service available. I would recommend the Hotel Langlois for those sightseeing in Paris and the standard of the rooms for a 2-star hotel exceeded my expectations. I would return to the hotel for another stay, especially if wifi access could be provided!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Langlois”
Reviews.Author: pvmkmyer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Langlois for 6 nights in February around Valentine's Day, based upon recommendations on Tripadvisor. It lived up to all our expectations. My wife is handicapped. They assigned us a large room with an enormous bath on the 1st floor. Unfortunately, after we got up to the room the romantic, but aged, elevator broke. They relocated us to a ground floor room which we enjoyed very much for the remained of our stay. It took a couple days for the part to arrive for the elevator, so it's a good thing we opted for the ground floor room. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the bathroom had all the modern touches, including a hairdryer. Breakfast was added on to the bill and was very good. In addition to the normal French breakfast of one baguette and one croissant, they had a spread of cheeses and cold meats; yogurts; an egg cooker, fruit, and a variety of regular and sweet breads and rolls, including croissants. Although breakfast would have been cheaper at the cafe down the street, we felt it was (1) worth the money; and (2) worth the convenience since it was February and we didn't want to venture out in the cold and drizzle just to save a couple euros. We met our friends from Belgium at the hotel. She is a travel agent and was impressed with the hotel. She thought that the only reason it was government rated as 2* instead of 3* was because the breakfast room is small. Apparently a 3* is supposed to be able to seat a larger percentage of its guests at one time. it is definitely nicer than other 3* hotels I've stayed in. The staff was helpful; the breakfast waitress was very friendly albeit with very limited English. The location is convenient. Because of my wife's handicap we cannot take the Metro, but there was a taxi stand at the end of the street in front of the Trinite church. BTW, there is a wonderful unknown chocolate shop just to the right of the church as you are facing it from the front. We will be returning to the Hotel Langlois hopefully this December and looking forward to our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bergenman
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent, with a metro station at the end of the road and walking distance to many interesting sites. The room ( #55 ) was really big, i think it was twice the size of the room at Hotel Concorde St. Lazare (a 4 star hotel in the neighbourhood) we stayed at last year. The bathroom was a bit small but absolutely ok. The room was very nicely furnitured. For €130 it is really a bargain. It was a little bit noisy, traffic noise and noise from other rooms, but not annoying. The breakfast (€11) was good. A huge plus for free internet access. The first impression of the staff was not very good. Then we checked in the man in the reception was more interested in the television, and he barely spoke a word english. Then we discovered that the aircondition did not work, we told him but he responded in french, after a while I managed him to take a look. He didnt manage to get the air condition to work, and then I asked him if we could get another room, I didnt understand the answer. I think he told me, in mostly french, that no other rooms where available. Fortunately at the rest of the stay the staff was english speaking and very friendly. The cleaniness was excellent. I would recommend this hotel :-)

Reviews.Title: “The Longer I Stayed Here, The More I Liked It”
Reviews.Author: zolo
