The bathroom came with two glassed (curtained doors) and was large by European standards. The windows open allowing you to look down onto the street. You can just make out the top of the Sacre Coeur off in the distance. This is the same area where the movie "Amelie" was filmed and if you have watched this movie you will get this feel in and around the Hotel Langlois. Our room had air conditioning available and it was capable of turning our room to a near deep freeze if you wanted. We had read from previous reviews that there had been a lack of air conditioning... this is definitely not the case now and it can be easily adjusted up and down depending upon what you like. We felt the cleaning staff at the Hotel Langlois took great efforts to help make are stay better than we could have hoped for. We had left a "Teddy Bear" out on a chair before we headed out one morning and when we returned we found him lounging on our bed with legs crossed. There were other little things the staff did as well that really made us feel welcome but I think this was one of the little things that looking back still brings a smile to my face. The rooms are definitely well kept. The free internet service was great. The front counter staff can speak a little English but if you know some french it makes it a little easier. The Hotel Langlois will be our first choice if we ever stay in Paris again. The price is more than right for the value you receive there.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: nedor
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon trip based on the reviews on trip advisor. What a great hotel. We had a wonderful room on the top floor with fantastic views of the Sacre Cour. Room was huge for a Paris city hotel, and the staff were most friendly. The location is excellent with all the major sites within comfortable walking distance. Good tip though, don't bother with breakfast as there is an excellent bakery right next door. We bought our food there and ate at our table in the room while looking over the rooftops of Paris. We will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “I agree!”
Reviews.Author: robbed
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed at the Hotel Langlois for four nights. At first, I wasn't so sure about the neighborhood and being far from sites. But we weren't at all. We walked to everything, but took the subway back. The folks who work at the Langlois were very nice. We stayed in a suite that accomodated us well, but for the last night needed two seperate rooms since I made a mistake when I reserved. They did give us two rooms, moved our luggage for us, and gave us a very much coveted air-conditioned room! When I checked out and paid for our stay, I realized that they only charged us for the suite again for the last night! That saved a bit of money. I doubt that there is a better deal in Paris. In the neighborhood we picked up outstanding coissants for 1 euro. Breakfast for 1 euro? My children voted their stay in Paris the best of our 2 week adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Still nice after 15 years”
Reviews.Author: herdingcats
Reviews.Content: Once we stepped in my wife and I both immediately recognized the lobby, reception, and elevator as the same hotel we had stayed at fifteen years ago as poor students. The hotel has a new name and is under new management, but our stay was every bit as pleasant as the first time. The new management has obviously put some money into the hotel, including air conditioning and art work. The rooms are large, the bathrooms are also large, the owners and staff are very friendly, and the breakfast is a reasonably good deal for Paris. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, lovely stay.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Langlois is a Parisian gem. The staff was very helpful and kind, the room was tastefully appointed and relatively quiet (no street noise and minimal noise from other rooms). The location is perfect and the price moderate. The computer in the lobby with Internet access was a big help to us. The bathtub in our room was perfect for a long, hot bubble bath to sooth our travel-weary bodies. We also took advantage of what the surrounding neighborhood had to offer: the sandwich and pastry shops for breakfast and lunch, a self-service laundry just down the street, a corner sidewalk-cafe for sitting and watching the world rush past. With the metro, bus stop and taxi stand close by, we found this the hotel a convenient base from which to explore the city. AND it is within walking distance of shopping along Boulevard Hausmann: Printemps, the Galleries Lafayette and Marks & Spencer. Yes, the hotel has its imperfections, but they only add to the quaint charm of this Parisian experience. We were there to see Paris and when we returned to our room at the Hotel Langlois each night we slept very well indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Find in Paris!!!”
Reviews.Author: CADreamin
Reviews.Content: After many weeks of searching through various opinion-based web sites, I booked the Hotel Langlois for a four night stay in May. What an absolutely charming little hotel!! Our room was on the fourth floor and furnished in the art deco style. The bathroom was almost as big as the bedroom and extremely well equipped. While our room was located at the "back" of the hotel, it was very quiet and had wonderful breezes coming through the three very large windows (which was nice because we were there during a mini-heat wave that Europe was experiencing). The staff was exceptionally friendly and most everyone spoke English. The breakfast, at first, seemed a little pricey; however, after checking out many of the local eateries, my husband declared that it was actually a pretty good deal. Hotel Langolis is located near the metro and rail stop which was a very big plus since we were traveling Europe by train. Would we recommend it to friends/family: YES! Would we stay there again? YES!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay very much”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights after seeing the review on Trip Advisor. We were very happy with the location. We were able to get around easily on the subway. A great way to get places in Paris! I loved using the Paris subway!! At first it seemed daunting but it took 1/2 day to learn it and we used it constantly. This hotel is also close to one of the main bus stops, St. Lazare. in Paris. The subway entrance is 1/2 block from the hotel. The hotel was built in 1879. the rooms were a bit older looking but were large, clean and very comfortable. Our bathroom had been recently remodeled and was very nice along with the staff. There were alot of nice restaurants close by. We were at first concerned because it was more northeast but we didn't really feel far away from anything. I would stay there again without a doubt!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hawk0476
Reviews.Content: Great Location. Close to the Metro and close enought to most of the sites for those who prefer to see Paris from ground level ! - Louvre 20 mins, Place De Le Concord 15 mins. Staff very freindly could not do more to make our stay perfect. We stayed for Breakfast which at 09 euros was very good but if your prefer there are many good cafe's close by. From the airport get the Roissey bus, it drops you at the Opera which is 5-10 minutes walk. Room was very clean and tastefull furnished as was the hotel. This is not a chain hotel and thus may not appeal to all but if you are looking for a hotel that is a little bit of old France this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: co9222
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weeks stay at the Hotel Langlois (July 15-22, 2005). It was a perfect hotel for us; a quiet neighborhood that became a sanctuary after the jam-packed sightseeing days, pleasant staff, very tastefully decorated common rooms with a wonderful little elevator, a comfortable bedroom with a quiet, remote-controlled air-conditioning unit, great thick towels in the bathroom, a view of Sacre Coeur, and even free internet access. The neighborhood provided all our needs--a quick half block to the Metro, two banks with ATM access within a half block, a post office a half block away, a little Brasserie for coffee and croissants in the morning (and even a decent dinner at night if you are too exhausted to return to the touristy areas) right next to the Metro entrance, a nice little patisserie, and only a few blocks from the renowned Galleries Lafayette Department Stores (foodies--you need to see the Galleries Lafayette Gourmet Foods department!) All in all, we were thrilled with this little hotel in the ninth arrondissement and will certainly return to it when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Langlois is a classic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from July 1-4. I was pleasantly suprised by this hotel. The room that my wife and I had was very large (quadruple the size of most of the others we stayed at) with excellent views of Sacre Coure and Trinity Churches. No bland room here- fireplace, enormous armoire, a good sized bathroom and clean enough to eat off the floor. This was a great intro to France for my wife who has not been before, but who heard the horror stories from others. Best thing about the Langlois is that it is off the beaten path of the major sights (though only a few minutes by metro). You can enjoy your stay without having to be surrounded by english-speaking tourist with short-shorts, hip-sacks, and very loud voices-- here is a place that actually makes you feel like you are in Paris (rather than in a Holiday Inn in Ohio). Though the staff and buisnesses around will try to speak some English if you are polite enough to try to speak French, the language barrier adds the the experience and adventure. We loved Langois and would go back in a second. It is well worth a look! I truely enjoyed my stay

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: BenoitChartier
Reviews.Content: Room is very large by Paris standards, no luxury; just the essentials, can't beat the rates!

Reviews.Title: “Met Expectations - Good Staff Recommendations”
Reviews.Author: babygame
Reviews.Content: Stayed here July 1-3, 2005. Nice location (close to Trinity church) and excellent staff. Gave us great recommendations on nearby restaurant (Restaurant of 2 Theaters, just around corner, 32 Euros priced fixed for champagne, wine, and 3-course meal with many excellent choices), where to boat the Seine from (Eiffel Tower - we picked boat with shortest line), where to buy food (nearby convenience store), and how to get to CDG (Roussy bus at Opera). Only shortcomings - even with the fan - the room was hot! We had just missed a major heat wave in the City so I can only imagine what previous week was like (bad). We had view across alley of an office type building (room 32); luckily they were gone for rest of our stay. Also, on Sat. and Sun. the nearby Patissierie is closed. On Sunday, almost everything is closed so plan ahead. We didn't breakfast at the hotel, so cannot comment on that. Did smell the food cooking early in the morning!! Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would go here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: OxfordGirlOxfordUK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here following the reviews on here for our 15th wedding anniversary, it did not disappoint. We stayed in suite 34 as requested which was lovely. Hotel is well positioned, staff were lovely, there is a nice bakery just a few doors along, overall a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable -appealing- place !”
Reviews.Author: triptraveller
Reviews.Content: Hotel Langlois is a memorable place - evoking the experience of Parisian hotels of numbers of decades ago--except that now (and not then !), prviate baths are present. The small lobby, old evelvator, rooms with 'mixed decor' of furnishings, and tall shuttered windows overlooking the courtyard will remind some of their earlier times in Paris, and for others, offer the present-day experience, which one is glad still exists. In addition, the service is very good. Helpful - and patient- staff respond to requests for assistance/advice. One hopes that this hotel does not respond to the pressures of 'moderniation' and 'updates' that would essentially rob it of its appeal and charm.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and romantic!”
Reviews.Author: Jane22
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I chose this hotel after reading rave reviews on tripadvisor, and were not disappointed. After confirming our booking, I read a review which stated that room 64 had great views. Chancing my luck I emailed the reservation line, and requested room 64. Of course I recieved the mandatory email informing me that they could not 100% guarantee specific rooms but would try and accomodate us. I did not hold much hope. However, upon arrival I was informed that room 64 was already booked. The receptionist then informed us that she had taken the liberty of up grading us to a suite at no extra cost! As u can imagine we were more than pleased. We stayed in room 24, it was excellent as I smoke, and the added luxury of having a "living room" meant that the bedroom did not smell like an ashtray. the room did overlook the street, but we didn't find traffic noise a problem. We didn't opt for the breakfast. One because we were never up early enough, and two, because we felt it was a little expensive for a few bread rolls. In the morning we grabbed a filled baguette from th nearby stalls and stashed a couple for lunch in our bags. The local franprix was also a saviour and we stocked up on cheap vino! The Gare du Lazare is 5 mins away and will bring you to all the major sights with a transfer or two. Sacre Coeur and the Moulin Rouge are very close and definitely worth a look, however, I would be wary of travelling at night as ladies of the night do frequent the Pigalle district! All in all loved the hotel, very quaint and more than comfortable, close to all attractions and homely. I would definitely stay here again. Photos to be posted.

Reviews.Title: “Are we talking about the same hotel???”
Reviews.Author: LindaAustralia
Reviews.Content: I too recently stayed in Room #31 as part of an 8 week trip around the world and Hotel Langlois was the worst room hubby and I encountered. True, it was a large room with huge bathroom but the 'antique' furniture for us meant old and broken. One bedside table door and one cupboard door didn't open, the bed creaked terribly (as we know the floor does too) and was a double when we had been confirmed a queen. The 'log' style pillow was very uncomfortable. Acoustics where poor, we were asked to turn down the TV which we did not have up very high. Room was so hot we had to request a fan. There were no tea making facilities. As for the convenience of the metro a few steps away, we could hear the underground trains rumbling by all night! The room is certainly affordable and the staff are very helpful but I would not recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Charm and ideal location”
Reviews.Author: calib
Reviews.Content: After a jarring ride from the train station in rush hour traffic it was comforting to walk into the calm of the Langlois. Friendly staff with clean rooms filled with character and beautiful floral oil paintings. Our room faced the side (courtyard) where the view was not impressive, but generally quiet. The room was comfortable in size, but the bath was on the smaller side. The towels and appointments were well above average. For 96 euros it far surpassed our expectations and the bar fridge made it convenient to stock water, wine and snacks that we purchased in nearby shops. Good walking shoes are essential in Paris, as is a hotel close to a metro stop. The Langlois is about 100 ft. from the Trinte stop which made getting to areas outside of walking distance quick and easy. The grand stores of boulevard Haussmann are close as is the Moulin Rouge. A mist filled morning spent in Montmartre and visting the Basilique du Sacré-Coeur and a simple evening sipping wine and nibbling cheese on the bank of the Seine may seem cliche, but made for the perfect Paris vacation. An evening at the old-world Cabaret Lapin Agile in Montmartre offered a glimpse into French folk song and tales performed by a colorful Parisian family. An attraction not to be missed is Sainte-Chapelle ("Holy Chapel"), located within the Palais de Justice complex on the Ile de la Cité in the center of Paris. You will have to go through some security to get in, but it is a truly memorable spectacle that will stay with you long after you return home. A riverboat ride along the Seine is also a fascinating way to get a different perspective on the city. An all day pass is affordable and you can hop on at the Louvre, travel down river to the Eiffel Tower and then return back as the sun sets and the city lights create their own romance. Paris is a city that takes time to visit. If you have only a few days pick the attractions you want to see carefully and allow some time to enjoy the simple things that make the city so wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: young_urbanite
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend & I stayed here for 4nights last December in a particularly bitter Paris winter. We booked the hotel through its own website and paid on our departure. Langlois is a small hotel, close to Gare St.Lazare. Though not immediately nearby any of the more touristy areas, we often walked to the Louvre and there is enough nearby to keep you going. I would recommend getting a tube to go eat but only for an evening meal, and only because many of Paris' best restaurants are off the beaten track (Try Willy's Wine Bar). We stayed in a second floor room (small lift isn't necessary except for the infirm) without no view. However the room was exceptionally large for the price, with grand antique furnishings and a large clean bathroom (superb deep bath!) The decor may not have been to everyone's taste (red&green in our room, slightly baroque feel) but I enjoyed it since most cheap hotels have zip character. From memory we did get charged slightly more than the website quoted but given the large comfortable room, friendly service (helps if you have basic French) and reasonable location I doubt many people will leave unhappy.

Reviews.Title: “Let me join the chorus”
Reviews.Author: bearinthefield
Reviews.Content: You will not find a better hotel in Paris for the money. We stayed in #31 for 104 Euros. It had a bathroom bigger than ours at home and was quiet, facing the inner courtyard. The floors do creak as others have said, but I will take that as a part of its character over a sterile Ibis or such. It was absolutely clean and the 12 ' ceilings with double french doors to the bathroom were charming. I expected Cary Grant to walk down the carpeted stairs in a dinner jacket or spring out of the tiny cage elevator. The staff was very friendly and helpful (offering us coffee and pastries in the front hall as we waited for our departure taxi, at no expense, and use of the e mail in the office as examples). For balance, the only downside I can find is that it is not a 10-15 minute walk to the major attractions as Notre Dame etc, but that is offset by its proximity to the metro stop, the CDG bus stop etc. Not all of the furniture in the room was old, antique type stuff. If you are looking for an older, affordable classic Paris hotel with style, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “A gem...and very Parisian”
Reviews.Author: southernsibyll
Reviews.Content: Okay, we got to Paris after a very long train ride from Amsterdam (a 4-hour-ride that became 7 hours when someone "expire" on the train), so at 3 a.m. we stumble into the Hotel Langlois. The guy on duty wasn't the friendliest guy in the world, but I think he could see that we weren't up for a lot of small talk...or he could have not spoken any English (who knows). All I could think was, "Get me to my room." And our room at Hotel Langlois more than lived up to our hopes. It was furnished with lovely antiques. It had high ceilings. A small terrace. The bathroom was small, but clean and equipped with all the necessities (including a hair dryer). The bathtub was extra-deep. It was everything you hope a Parisian hotel would be, and for the money, it's a steal (but, shhhh, don't tell anyone). We option to not have the breakfast, although the cost is very comparable to anything else you'll find. Fortunately, there is a WONDERFUL pastry shop two doors down. It is in a great, not-too-touristy area of the city. We walked to the Louvre the first day, so you can do that or take the Metro which is a few yards away or a but which is right across the street. How convenient! While the service didn't improve much (the front desk wasn't "English-friendly" and my husband's French skills were not that helpful), we were very pleased with our stay and are recommending it to our friends and to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Langlois from April 22-25, 2005. It was our first trip to Paris. Overall, the hotel was an excellent value. The exterior and lobby are wonderful. The room was acceptable for an older hotel. The bathroom was very small. The rate was 96 euros a night for a room on the back side with a large double window. Compared to other hotels we’ve stayed at, the room would be rated a 2-star hotel. The worst part of the hotel stay was the “creakiness” of the floors. The floors creaked whenever anyone walked in or around the room, including hallways and adjacent rooms. Creaky noises were present at all hours of the day. Not good for light or late sleepers. After work hours and at night, the world is incredibly quiet. We left the window open all day and night. No air conditioning was provided, but it was not needed this time of year. The closest metro stop, a half-block away, doesn’t take you anywhere you want to go unless you are willing to station-hop around the Metro system. Its more efficient to hike to and from the three outlying Metro stops. There is a great corner food store (Franprix) about 2 short blocks from the hotel. I strongly suggest you stock up on food and drinks from this market. The store had great prices, when compared to local cafes and the in-room mini-bar prices. It was fun to try locally produced drinks, fruits, breads, cookies and cheeses purchased from the store. My overall impression of Paris – a great place to visit but I wouldn’t want to live there. Traffic in Paris was horrendous. Don’t even consider renting a car. We traveled by Metro the entire trip. At certain times, people were packed like sardines in these moving tin cans. The Louvre was the first and best site visited, and what a great value! Other must-see sights were not as spectacular, in my opinion. A word from the wise – travel light. Your back will appreciate it. Finally, we thought that Parisians were beautiful people, well dressed but a little snobbish. We also visited the Netherlands, a much more inviting and livable place than Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Paris and althought I had no other hotels in Paris with which to compare Hotel Langlois, we found the hotel to be very nice. The room was sufficiently roomy and clean. More importantly, however, was the accommodating staff. The staff was very cordial and was always willing to assist us in navigating Paris. Location was excellent. About half a block from the Metro. Near several restaurants and near Prentemps and Galeries Lafayette, two major department stores. Paris is very expensive, primarily because of the present rate of exchange. Consequently, we purchased most of our dinners from local stores in the neighborhood. Further up Rue Saint Lazare are neighborhood stores where you can purchase cheese, wine, meats, bread and fruit. After a full day of sight seeing, we enjoyed buying a bottle of wine, some cheese, salami, fruit and bread and taking it back to the room for a relaxing evening meal. Near the hotel is a very popular bakery where you can purchase breads, prepared quiche and salads. The standard room at 96 Euros is a bargain. For a two-star hotel, I thought it was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel in a terrific area.”
Reviews.Author: Wolftrapper
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Langlois is an excellent value. I just returned from staying 5 nights at this hotel. It is located on a quiet street in the 9th district within walking distance of many of the Paris sights. The Metro, city bus, eateries are all very close by and the Roissy Bus, to and from CDG airport, is only a short walk. The staff of the Langlois were all terrific, especially the three women that I met over the 6 days who worked at the front desk. There is a computer with free internet access for guests to use. Because of all the places to eat in Paris, I did not have breakfast at the hotel so I can not speak to that. Rooms were clean and very confortable and as I already said my room was very quiet. I had a room facing the courtyard and was able to keep the windows open whenever I was in the room. This is important to me since many hotels in Paris have rooms facing noisy, busy streets. Another nice feature of this hotel is that the rooms are not all the same. Each has its own style and features. I have stayed at other hotels in Paris, however, when I return the Hotel Langlois will be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: zekid1
Reviews.Content: Had a large, comfortable room..Staff was very nice and accomodating. Had internet access in lounge. Outside to the right are some very good cheese shops. Convenient to the Metro and restaurants to the left.

Reviews.Title: “High expectations; serious disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After much research (Trip Advisor & every other source we could find) we were thrilled to be able to book three nights for our family of four at the Hotel Langlois. The chance to stay at the #4 rated hotel in all of Paris for a very reasonable price seemed like a wonderful opportunity. We were assigned to the attic apartment where we found our room to be nothing close to the photos and/or room descriptions on the internet. The Hotel Langlois website speaks of "Ecole de Nancy" furniture & crafted mahogany and sycamore headboards ... Our double bed was a portable bed w/ no headboard, sitting about 6 inches off the ground. I don't believe "Ecole de Nancy" furniture includes the wicker and particle board pieces in our room. Paint was peeling off the walls in several places. The space had great potential. - It was good-sized (the reason they told us we were placed there). There was a small kitchen. The bathroom was nice. And there was an incredible view of Sacre-Coeur. But it was as though the room was an afterthought. - A place for families when everything else was occupied. Certainly not representative of what I would expect from the #4 hotel in Paris. I would suggest that Hotel Langlois paint & furnish the attic so that it measures up to the rest of their facility. A little work and a small investment would make that space a highlight of a Paris vacation instead of a source of disgust and disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with central location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a fabulous 3 night stay at the Hotel Langlois - booked based on tripavisor recommendations. We had a lovely romantic room on the top floor, with a great view across Parisian rooftops and a glimpse of the Sacre Coeur. We paid 110 Euros a night for the room which was big and tastefully furnished with dark wood antique furniture. The real surprise for me was how centrally located this hotel was for the money and ambience. The ‘Roissybus’ Shuttle bus from the Charles De Gaulle airport cost only 8.50 Euros each and deposited us in Place d’Opera which was an easy 10 minute walk to the hotel (past the fabulous department store Gallerie La Fayette). We enjoyed an evening in Montmartre restaurants and bars a fifteen minute walk away and the Louvre and Champs Elyses are only a few short metro stops away. On booking this hotel we thought that the optional 9 Euro breakfast sounded expensive and attempted to find somewhere cheaper in the locality only to discover that the hotel breakfast was competitively priced and had realistic serving times, so we did not have to get up too early to enjoy it. We had a wonderful weekend away at this friendly, reasonable and charming hotel and would recommend it to anyone as a good central base in a lively and beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds expectations - great value/location”
Reviews.Author: Rubik000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a week in March in this lovely hotel which has much more than what we expected for a two-star hotel and its rates: - Location: Trinité Metro station is on the corner, 50m away from the hotel. 5-minute walk to Opera and maybe 10-15' to Place Concorde. Lovely area, convenience stores, patisseries and restaurants all close-by. - Room: good size, lovely decoration, it even had a mini-bar! good size bathroom by European standards. Very romantic too. - Service: friendly staff, no complaints whatsoever. The hotel has a computer on the lobby for e-mail and Internet browsing, completely free for all guests. Amazing. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again on my next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “romantic”
Reviews.Author: wimpiot
Reviews.Content: after 5 stays in this hotel and a few stays in other hotels in Paris i know this is the best for the price. Last WE we did not have the best room (14) but 98 € is not so much for this place. We will return !!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: gcollins
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 7 nights at this hotel in room 31 which had a double bed and a large bathroom. We had a twin bed added since there were 3 of us. The room was quiet and ample. There was no view, but that was okay. Breakfast was 9 euros which is better than in a restaurant for the food you get, but much easier to walk outside the hotel to the little patisserie close by and get a croissant and orange juice. Good place for lunch! The Trinite metro stop is the nearest one. Being in the 9th makes it a quieter hotel than most, but still convenient to attractions if you use the metro. The staff at the front desk understood English very well. The drinks in the refrigerator in the room are reasonably priced which is unusual for a hotel. I would definitely stay here again. There is computer access in the breakfast room as well. The cost for the room was 110 euros. There was no additional charge for the extra bed/person.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms and fabulous views....”
Reviews.Author: lasscass
Reviews.Content: If you get one of the top 2 floors, that is. I had high expectations of this hotel, and for the most part those expectations were met, but I had to do some negotiating first, which displeased me. I made my reservation two months in advance, and specifically asked for a street facing room, on one of their higher floors, but apon check in was given room 32, (3rd floor up out of 7 floors) and it was facing a courtyard which was not only dreary but a tad creepy due to the fact that it seems to be some sort of office building and is deserted totally at night. And I adore and require fresh air, and apon thrusting open the windows I noticed that just to the right of the window is pideon central and a TON of guano (pidgeon poo)...so I kept my window shut. But I must say that I immediatly went down to reception and kindly reminded the very nice young lady that my reservation was for a street view room and she told me that they are not able to make an guarantees, and that for today she could not place me in a street view, so I inquired about tommorow and she said they could place me in a street room then, so I was fine with that. And indeed the next day they did infact transfer me into a new room, which was FABULOUS! Room #64 with a beautiful window and railing that looked out far above the buildings across the street and had a fabulous full on view of Sacre Coeur, which is lit up at night. I noticed a fellow lodger posted a few photos, including the view from the room of #63, which was the third window to my left, so I had a clearer view of Sacre Coeur than they did, just for your reference. The bathroom had a great opening window too. There was a nice seating area, which consisted of a table and two chairs. There was also another chair by the heater. The view and fresh air from the window was so nice that a few nights I opted to "dine in" so to speak, and brought home a hot quiche from a patisserie, and some cheese, wine and various snacks. I really enjoyed staying in room #64. The housekeeping staff were very nice and the reception staff was very nice too, but even with using quite a bit of limited french, there really was a huge communication gap. ( I did order breakfast in my room, over the phone, entirely in french, though lousy, which the lady understood perfectly) but idealy if you spoke fluent french, this is the best. I opted not to ask for directions or help in locating things in town because I knew how difficult it would be for us to understand one another. All in all though, a very pleasant stay, and the staff is willing to accomodate your desires, if you are able to make yourself understood. I highly recommend having your breakfast delivered to your room, and enjoying your view and coffee. A delight! Oh, one other note...the elevator has one large iron door one opens first, and then a pair of wood and rattan inner doors, which can be held open by attaching them to little grabber hooks inside the elevator...anyway, apon exiting the elevator, if you fail to unhook these two inner doors, and just shut the outer iron door, and walk away....the elevator stays on that floor. Forever. Or, untill someone comes along and closes the doors or uses the elevator from that floor. So I did have to walk up 7 flights of stairs TWICE in one day because someone had forgotten to close the doors. The staff never told me about this or that I should pay attention to be sure to close the doors each time I rode the elevator, so I think this is something they should really stress to the guests. A terribly sweet elevator though!! An old Otis sweetie that just goes silently up and down all day. Wooden and tiny. Oh, one more thing...the wooden floors in the rooms are so darn squeeky!! In the first room, #32 it was sooooo bad I felt guilty walking around at all, just knowing how awful it must sound below. But my second room only had one or two spots which were easy to avoid. I'd definately stay at this hotel again only next time I plan on renting an apartment. Have fun, folks!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: vacationhappy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights at the end of February and had a great time. We had a room with a HUGE bathroom and lovely decor, it was on the third floor. The best part was waking up each morning about 5AM to the smell of fresh baked goods. The breakfast was really wonderful and worth the extra $$ as it is right there. We also found that since it was freezing when we were there, we could take a taxi or the metro back for a very reasonable price. We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rmvUk
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel, it is in a great area, the rooms are very big and clean. The value for money of this hotel is fantastic. Could not fault it

Reviews.Title: “Great location & good value if you get the right room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Langlois would have received 5 stars from me if It hadn't been for the fact that we asked to change room. I booked a twin room 7 months in advance of my visit to Paris with my mother for her 75th Birthday & specifically asked for a room with a view. When we arrived we were given a twin room that looked out to a wall and was a bit dingy. Decor was ok, but I was pretty disappointed after reading the rave reviews on tripadvisor and having booked so early with my specific request. The bathroom of the twin room (room 32) was very small and you could quite clearly hear someone splashing around in the bath in the next room. When I asked for an alternative room, the receptionist was very helpful and showed me a number of rooms. There was a small private apartment on the 7th floor with great views, but all modern furniture. Another room had the same view as our twin room but had a double bed & was a bit brighter, but eventually I was shown what I think must have been a suite and that's where we stayed for 3 nights in art nouveau splendour. I was so glad that I had asked to be moved because it made such a difference to our holiday. We had an ornate carved double bed, huge bathroom hidden behind what looked like a cupboard door and our own sitting area. (room 44) Breakfast at €9 each for continental seemed a bit steep, so we went to the bakery a few doors away for breakfast for 2 people at €4. Fab, safe location - easy to walk to sacre coeur, opera, boulevard Haussman. Good access to metro & RER stations. I'd gladly stay at the Langlois again, but would specify a room number if possible and even be willing to pay the extra supplement to guarantee a bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “If you Dream of a Paris Hotel This Is It”
Reviews.Author: timtomp
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five night stay in Paris at the lovely Parisian Hotel Langlois. If you seen all the movies involving Paris or have heard the story of Walt Disney trying to buy an elevator from a French Hotel and the owner refused to sell, so Walt sent his imagineers over to Paris to duplicate the elevator at Club 33 in Disneyland, or if you just dreamed about a Paris Hotel from the 30's . . . This is that Hotel. A quaint hotel with a wonderful elevator and views from room 63 of Montmartre, Sacre-Coeur, and Paris rooftops. This hotel is exceptional and romantic. The location is great, restaurants, metro, Printemps, Gallery Lafayette, Moulin Rouge & a bounty of shops is all within walking distance. The price and the value is outstanding. I have stayed in some of the leading Hotels in the World, from the King David, Kahala Manderin, Ritz-Carlton, Mauna Kea, but the Hotel Langlois is the most romantic and quaint hotel I have found. Also, the staff was very helpful. If you want a great location, and a very Paris hotel that gives you outstanding value and is very romantic, book this hotel and spend your extra Euros on food, souvenirs, and nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: szlwzl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not only excellent value but also a genuinely nice place to stay. The staff were lovely and for 507 Euro we got a great room with a view onto Montmatre and breakfast every day. The location is superb with some great restaurants within walking distance including l'oenotheque at 20, rue st-lazare and others in the vicinity. Many of Paris's attractions are within walking distance and all others can be reached on the metro. This hotel seemed to have wireless internet access from the look of the computer downstairs although without having my laptop I couldn't check this properly.

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Goodiam
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August 2004. I picked this hotel due to the reviews and was not disappointed. The location is excellent and the rooms were larger than I could have ever expected from a ** hotel. It was quaint, friendly staff and even though it was a hot summer, the rooms were cool. Paris is an expensive city so stay here and spend your money down the Champs Elysee! All the positive comments about this hotel are true - it is a fantastic find!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, good value”
Reviews.Author: kmstraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife over a weekend and overall I was pleased. On the plus side the hotel is in a great location. It's close to the RER, Saint Lazare line (just down the street) and it's right around the corner from the Metro 12 line, Trinity station. There are some cafe's around the place to buy a cheap (relatively speaking) breakfast and it's in a good, quiet area. I like the decor and the rooms and bathrooms were adequate in size. On the negative side, I'd have to say that I was disappointed with thickness of the walls and floors. I could hear people walking around upstairs, conversations in other rooms and out in the hallways as well as running water in the bathroom beside us. They cleaned our rooms every day but they didn't replace the towels which in the end isn't so bad but may bother others. Overall, I think I'd stay here again. I thought the price was reasonable at 96 euro per night.

Reviews.Title: “Biggest and maybe even the best in Paris”
Reviews.Author: hksp26
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here on a few occasions while in Paris and have always been very pleased. I have never stayed in a bigger room in Paris, nor perhaps in Europe, for that matter. This place allows you to actually move around instead of shimmying sideways to get from one side of the room to the other. The bathrooms and large and spacious too. There is a lift and though small, it does the trick. Unfortunately, and probably because it has grown so popular, it has gone up in price from when we paid around 79 euros with breakfast last year to this year where we most recently paid 96 euros with no breakfast. Still, for under 100 euro it is an amazing deal for Paris. You can walk to the Opera and the shopping streets easily and if there is anything out of your reach, the hotel is just around the corner from a metro stop, making gettting around very easy. This hotel will be the spice of your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Good value, Central”
Reviews.Author: Stuart1956
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 4 nights from Jan 23rd based on the comments we had previously read on this site and we were not disappointed. We were in room 62 which was a good size, clean and had a comfortable bed. The room had a couple of interesting old features such as carved wooden posts surrounding a small window bay with a table and chairs. There was also an unusual tiled fireplace. The hotel is good value and central - 10 mins easy walk to the Opera and 20-25 mins to the Louvre. The Metro is only 100 metres away so linking to anywhere in the city is easy and quick. Lots of restaurants within 10 -15 mins walk towards Opera. The Patisserie 50 metres along the road is brilliant with lots of delicious cakes etc. We will certainly book in again when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “good deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I work for a major airline and have stayed at more than a few european hotels. This hotel was really a good deal. Nothing fancy, but very clean,very quiet, and a certain amount of charm. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is good for airport transfer, and a healthy, but pleasant walk to the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Ozzie_in_Ireland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Langlois last week for 3 nights on a holiday visit. There were 7 in our party. My husband and I stayed in a double room, while my brother, his wife and their 3 children stayed in a suite which was very reasonably priced for so central a hotel. I had had a lot of trouble finding a budget hotel in central Paris that could accommodate my brother's family in one room, so after much searching on the web was delighted to see the reviews for the Hotel Langlois on this web site and took the chance of booking. We were all very happy with the hotel. It is perfectly situated for sight-seeing, and was within walking distance of the Louvre, Opera, Palais Royale, large department stores, the Roissy Bus, L'Open Tour Bus and Metro. There were a good number of restaurants (French and ethnic) nearby, though I would recommend trying to go further afield if you have a smaller party than ours, as we had difficulty finding any interesting or particularly French culinary treats close by apart from the cake shop next to the hotel and the creperie booth opposite the Trinity church. But the French restaurants nearby did offer good size portions of standard 'pub' fare and were helpful in regard to children's meals. The hotel itself was very clean, the breakfast buffet was fresh and there was plenty of it, and the hotel has obviously gone through a recent refurbishment. There are also many pleasing period features retained throughout the building. Our only complaint was that the rooms were very warm at night. But the weather was unseasonably mild during our stay, so the heating system may not have been able to adjust.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and decent price!”
Reviews.Author: ktinak
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation at the hotel based on the reviews I read here on TripAdvisor. We stayed one night during the month of November. The hotel is in a good location for getting to many sights in Paris. We were within a short taxi ride to the Louvre, which was our main destination. The interior of the hotel was quaint and the room was fine, but not fantastic. For the price it was well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect play to stay”
Reviews.Author: jgt12
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel based on trip advisor reviews and were thrilled with the result. The room was spacious and well decorated. The staff was very friendly and even let us use their internet. The hotel is also very close to the Metro and lots of restaurants. I would definitely recommend staying at the Hotel Langlois!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ncp79
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris. It's located in a great area, decorated tastefully and is extremely reasonably priced. The rooms are very spacious with high ceilings. I didn't try the breakfast, there's a bakery just around the corner that sells amazing pastries for very reasonable prices. All the staff was extremely polite with the exception of the man who works the nights, he was quite rude. However, the rest of the staff went out of their way to make our stay a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “lovely Langlois.....”
Reviews.Author: vendepac
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at the Langlois Hotel including New Years Eve.... Decided on this hotel after reading all the trip advisor reports..... and was not dissapointed. I found it too be a really charming, typically Parisian hotel....The rooms we had, numbers 12 (99 euros)and 14 (89 euros)on the 1st (2nd?) floor, were both fairly large, although the bathrooms in both were very small. ( a bit of a suprise as the bathrooms shown on the web are all large) Our double room, No 14, had a 'Juliet' type of balcony overlooking the street below. Whenever the Central heating become too much, we opened the double french doors to this balcony to let in cooling air... The rooms and bathroom were spotlessly clean...and furnished in an ecletic style...not exactly antique, not exactly "junkshop' either... Very high ceilings added to the feeling of spaciousness. The double glazing on the French windows was excellent, blocked out all noise from the street ( although the hotel is on a quiet one way street). We did hear the person/s in the room above walking around early one morning though.... and the floorboards in our room did sqeak a bit... Was suprised to find a fridge in the room, and it was also stocked with the Langlois version of a 'minibar'.... very handy for keeping your beer and wine cold.... Staff were pleasant and friendly, but it does help to speak a little French....as they do not speak any English! Apart from Madame Bojena that is, who spoke a little English and was very helpful, ordering taxis's etc...We didnt partake of the Breakfast at Langlois, but preferred to pop around the corner to any number of Pattiseries etc.... By the way, avoid the cafe/restaurant along the street and on the first corner of Rue St Lazarre... as it was so close to the hotel, and so convenient, we ate here on the first evening.... we all ordered different Salads, and all were bloody awful... even the bread was below average... (the only thing good was the service!!!) Passing by the cafe a couple of times a day, we were always so suprised to see it full most of the time....surely they never got any repeat business!!!! But, it was the only time in paris where we did get poor food.... The hotel is very close to the department stores, the Opera etc... and is a pleasant 10min walk to Louvre... Will I stay at Langlois again? Although I normally like to stay at a different hotel in a different location when I return to a city, I probably will..... for the price I doubt there is a Hotel in Paris anywhere near as charming...clean....convenient...... if there is, I'd like to know about it... tt

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Langlois " A wonderful find "”
Reviews.Author: chee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Langlois on Dec. 24, 2004 for one night. We picked this hotel based on the reviews from trip advisor and we were not dissappointed. We stayed in a suite on the second floor facing the street and it was not noisy. The room and bathroom were large with very high ceilings and very clean. Also the bathroom had great water pressure and plenty of hot water. The only reason I didn't give this hotel 5 stars is because I'm very picky and felt the room could have used a fresh coat of paint by American standards but it added to its old world charm. Also the double bed seem to be the size of a full not a queen. My husband is 6'3 and I'm 5'7 but it made us have to snuggle. The staff was very friendly and informative. This hotel was close to everything by metro which was literally at the end of the block. I enjoyed the neighborhood with many restaurants and the Laffayette Mall. The Best thing was the bill...soooooo cheap for Paris....maybe I should have given it 5 stars!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Terry
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week (Christmas to New Years) at the Hotel Langlois. It was great. My mother had room 11 and both the bedroom and bath were huge - she was in heaven. My husband and I had room 22 and the bathroom was typical of a European bathroom and the bedroom was larger than others in more expensive hotels. The staff at the hotel were awesome - they could not do enough to help us out including standing outside for 15 minutes on New Year's Eve to make sure our cab came. The location was perfect - the area was quiet and charming with a great metro close by. We would definitely stay here again whemn we return to Paris. Many thanks for those who recommended the Ciel de Paris for New Year's Eve - what an incredible unforgettable experience

Reviews.Title: “A Moveable Feast”
Reviews.Author: M0g
Reviews.Content: The well-travelled writer Ernest Hemingway once complimented Paris as being "a moveable feast". Well, so is this hotel, for which we're indebted to this website and to those who've made such useful contributions to it. It's so helpful to have current opinions, even negative ones. Thus we weren't expecting a synthetically swish corporate hotel with robotic if multilingual staff. Just a small clean un-fussy well-run French establishment which offered value for money as well as some distinctively individual character. And that is exactly what we got. Room 15's bedroom and bathroom are both spacious and high-ceilinged and there's even an ante-room. Furniture and furnishings are suggestive of the building's history, but don't expect them to be pristine fresh - this is a deservedly popular hotel. There are no spectacular views from this first floor but you do overlook that section of the rue St Lazare, which is tucked away behind the Trinite Metro and is therefore relatively quiet and particularly so at night. The hotel's geographical convenience is well-documented on the website. And yes there are the usual suspects. The communal breakfast room on the ground floor is a bit of a squeeze. The buffet breakfast, though good value, is modest and mainly carbohydrate; that it's available for some four hours every morning allows for some flexibility about when you choose to eat but it does seem taxing for the one person who runs it. The central heating system works effectively if somewhat mysteriously so that when it was freezing or below outside we were always comfortable but the lack of air-conditioning would be an important consideration in summer. The management is, thankfully for us, very low-key; the reception staff handle things undemonstratively, pleasantly and competently; and with some geniality and tolerance if you try a few words of French. In our view the hotel entirely deserves its current high-rating. We very much hope it continues to maintain this standard and that that is monitored through subsequent reports on the Trip Advisor website. Enjoy the feast!

Reviews.Title: “Great for not making your hols feel like a business trip”
Reviews.Author: UK-James
Reviews.Content: I thought I might add my voice to the many reporting here... The hotel was great with the foyer and very cool lift setting the mood. The room (64) was clean (apart from the mysterious but inoffensive appearance of an empty wrapper marked "Trojan") and had a great view of the Sacre Coeur over the rooftops. The furniture was warm (in feeling, not temperature although that was fine). The staff was helpful and patient with my French. We didn't try the television / look in the minibar since there was no shortage of entertainment or bars even in a very wet and windy December Paris. We didn't try the breakfast either as there's no shortage of cafes to find a coffee and a croissant. Since I travel relatively frequently with business, I find it difficult to drop into holiday (vacation) mode in the sort of identi-room seen in most cities in most countries, and when I'm off for a long weekend with my fiancee we don't need a pool on site, great conference facilities and 2,134 channels of TV to alleviate the boredom of a soulless cell. This place was the perfect antidote. I gather the previous reviewer's successors in room 63 (or 62) also enjoyed their stay from the faintly audible expressions of pleasure (ahem), but other than that and some gently gurgling plumbing, the place was quiet. Obviously the place has a certain mood to it... Hausman is very close so perfect for shoppers, but everywhere is walkable and the metro is less than two minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Place, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Kristez
Reviews.Content: Another wonderful stay from a hotel I chose blindly from trip advisor. This hotel is very European and cute, it is located on a semi-quiet street close to the Mulan Rouge and only one block to the nearest Metro station. The rooms were decorated well, we were lucky to see two of them as they has missed booked us one night and gave us an extra room for free. They have antique decorations, comfortable beds, and some with balcony's onto the street. There are many nice streets surrounding that you can cruise through during the day, cute boutique shops and restaurants mostly. If you enjoy walking, the Sacre Couer and Monte Martre is very close as well, maybe a 20 minute walk or so. Book early, we booked over a month in advance and could only get four of our six nights there. When we moved hotel to a higher rating (3 star) and payed literally double, the 3 star hotel was horrible! All in all, a very nice place at an incredible rate. I will definately stay here my next time in Paris.
